Text

Late one night , in the spring of 1830 , [two men]205-two men issued from [a low , obscurely situated public - house]206-a low , obscurely situated public - house , near [Millbank]1-millbank , and shaped [their]205-two men course apparently in the direction of [Vauxhall Bridge]2-vauxhall bridge . Avoiding [the footpath near [the river]208-the river]207-the footpath near the river , [they]205-two men moved stealthily along the farther side of [the road]209-the road , where [the open ground]210-the open ground offered [them]205-two men an easy means of flight , in case such a course should be found expedient . So far as it could be discerned by the glimpses of the moon , which occasionally shone forth from a rack of heavy clouds , the appearance of [these personages]211-these personages was not much in [their]205-two men favour . Haggard features , stamped deeply with the characters of crime and debauchery ; fierce , restless eyes ; beards of several days ’ growth ; wild , unkempt heads of hair , formed their chief personal characteristics ; while sordid and ragged clothes , shoes without soles , and old hats without crowns , constituted the sum of [their]205-two men apparel . [One of [them]205-two men]212-one of them was tall and gaunt , with large hands and feet ; but despite [his]212-one of them meagreness , [he]212-one of them evidently possessed great strength : the other was considerably shorter , but broad - shouldered , bow - legged , long - armed , and altogether [a most formidable ruffian]213-a most formidable ruffian . [This fellow]214-this fellow had high cheek - bones , a long aquiline nose , and a coarse mouth and chin , in which the animal greatly predominated . [He]214-this fellow had a stubby red beard , with sandy hair , white brows and eyelashes . The countenance of the other was dark and repulsive , and covered with blotches , the result of habitual intemperance . [His]214-this fellow eyes had a leering and malignant look . A handkerchief spotted with blood , and tied across [his]214-this fellow brow , contrasted strongly with [his]214-this fellow matted black hair , and increased [his]214-this fellow natural appearance of ferocity . [The shorter ruffian]215-the shorter ruffian carried a mallet upon [his]215-the shorter ruffian shoulder , and [[his]215-the shorter ruffian companion]216-his companion concealed something beneath the breast of [his]215-the shorter ruffian coat , which afterwards proved to be a dark lantern . Not a word passed between [them]205-two men ; but keeping a vigilant look - out , [they]205-two men trudged on with quick , shambling steps . A few sounds arose from [the banks of [the river]208-the river]217-the banks of the river , and there was now and then a plash in [the water]219-the water , or a distant cry , betokening [some passing craft]220-some passing craft ; but generally all was profoundly still . [The quaint , Dutch - looking structures on the opposite bank]221-the quaint , dutch - looking structures on the opposite bank , the line of [coal - barges]222-coal - barges and lighters moored to [the strand]223-the strand , [the great timber - yards]224-the great timber - yards and [coal - yards]225-coal - yards , [the brewhouses]226-the brewhouses , [gasworks]227-gasworks , and [waterworks]228-waterworks , could only be imperfectly discerned ; but the moonlight fell clear upon [the ancient towers of [Lambeth Palace]3-lambeth palace]229-the ancient towers of lambeth palace , and on [the neighbouring church]230-the neighbouring church . The same glimmer also ran like a silver belt across [the stream]231-the stream , and revealed [the great , stern , fortress - like pile of [the Penitentiary]233-the penitentiary]232-the great , stern , fortress - like pile of the penitentiary — perhaps [the most dismal - looking structure in [the whole metropolis]235-the whole metropolis]234-the most dismal - looking structure in the whole metropolis . [The world of habitations beyond [this melancholy prison]237-this melancholy prison]236-the world of habitations beyond this melancholy prison was buried in darkness . [The two men]238-the two men , however , thought nothing of these things , and saw nothing of them ; but , on arriving within a couple of hundred yards of [the bridge]239-the bridge , suddenly , as if by previous concert , quitted [the road]209-the road , and , leaping a rail , ran across [a field]241-a field , and plunged into [a hollow formed by a dried pit]242-a hollow formed by a dried pit , where [they]238-the two men came to a momentary halt . “ [You]243-the shorter individual ai n’t a - been a - gammonin ’ [me]243-the shorter individual in this matter , [Tinker]80-the tinker ? ”[243-the shorter individual] observed [the shorter individual]243-the shorter individual . “ The cove ’s sure to come ? ”[243-the shorter individual] “ Why , [you]243-the shorter individual ca n’t expect [me]244-the other to answer for another as [I]244-the other can for [myself]244-the other , [Sandman]81-the sandman , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other ; “ but if [his]244-the other own word ’s to be taken for it , [he]244-the other ’s sartin to be there . [I]244-the other heerd [him]244-the other say , as plainly as [I]244-the other ’m a speakin ’ to you—‘I’ll be here to - morrow night — at the same hour — — ’ ”[244-the other] “ And that wos [one o’clock]1425-one o’clock ? ”[81-the sandman] said [the Sandman]81-the sandman . “ Thereabouts , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other . “ And who did [he]244-the other say that to ? ”[81-the sandman] demanded [the Sandman]81-the sandman . “ To hisself , [I]246-the tinker s’pose , ”[246-the tinker] answered [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ for , as [I]246-the tinker told [you]246-the tinker afore , [I]246-the tinker could see [no one]1426-no one vith [him]244-the other . ”[246-the tinker] “ Do [you]246-the tinker think [he]244-the other ’s one of [our]1427-our perfession ? ”[247-the sandman] inquired [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Bless [you]246-the tinker ! no — that [he]244-the other ai n’t , ”[246-the tinker] returned [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ [He]244-the other ’s a reg’lar slap - up svell . ”[246-the tinker] “ That ’s no reason at all , ”[247-the sandman] said [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [Many a first - rate svell]1428-many a first - rate svell practises in [our]1427-our line . But [he]244-the other ca n’t be in [his]244-the other right mind to come to such a ken as that , and go on as [you]246-the tinker mentions . ”[247-the sandman] “ As to that [I]246-the tinker ca n’t say , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ and it do n’t much matter , as far as ve’re consarned . ”[246-the tinker] “ Devil a bit , ”[247-the sandman] rejoined [the Sandman]247-the sandman , “ except — [you’re]246-the tinker sure it worn’t [a sperrit]1429-a sperrit , [Tinker]80-the tinker . [I]247-the sandman ’ve heerd say that [this crib]1430-this crib is haanted , and though [I]247-the sandman do n’t fear [no livin ’ man]1431-no livin ’ man , [a ghost ’s a different sort of customer]1432-a ghost ’s a different sort of customer . ”[247-the sandman] “ [Vell]82-vell , [you]82-vell ’ll find [our]253-they svell raal flesh and blood , [you]82-vell may depend upon it , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ So come along , and do n’t let [’s]253-they be frightenin ’ [ourselves]253-they vith ould [vimen]1433-vimen ’s tales . ”[246-the tinker] With this [they]253-they emerged from the pit , crossed [the lower part of [the field]255-the field]254-the lower part of the field , and entered [a narrow thoroughfare , skirted by [a few detached houses]257-a few detached houses , which brought [them]253-they into [the Vauxhall Bridge Road]258-the vauxhall bridge road]256-a narrow thoroughfare , skirted by a few detached houses , which brought them into the vauxhall bridge road . Here [they]253-they kept on the side of [the street]259-the street most in shadow , and crossed over whenever [they]253-they came to a lamp . By - and - by , [two watchmen]260-two watchmen were seen advancing from [Belvoir Terrace]4-belvoir terrace , and , as [the guardians of the night]261-the guardians of the night drew near , [the ruffians]262-the ruffians crept into [an alley]263-an alley to let [them]260-two watchmen pass . As soon as [the coast]264-the coast was clear , [they]253-they ventured forth , and quickening [their]253-they pace , came to [a row of deserted and dilapidated houses]265-a row of deserted and dilapidated houses . This was [their]253-they destination . The range of habitations in question , more than a dozen in number , were , in all probability , what is vulgarly called “ in [Chancery]5-chancery , ”[253-they] and shared the fate of [most property similarly circumstanced]266-most property similarly circumstanced . [They]253-they were in a sad ruinous state — unroofed , without windows and floors . The bare walls were alone left standing , and these were in a very tumble - down condition . [These neglected dwellings]267-these neglected dwellings served as receptacles for old iron , blocks of stone and wood , and other ponderous matters . The aspect of [the whole place]268-the whole place was so dismal and suspicious , that it was generally avoided by [passengers]269-passengers after nightfall . Skulking along the blank and dreary walls , [the Tinker , who was now a little in advance]270-the tinker , who was now a little in advance , stopped before a door , and pushing it open , entered [the dwelling]271-the dwelling . [[His]270-the tinker , who was now a little in advance companion]216-his companion followed [him]270-the tinker , who was now a little in advance . The extraordinary and incongruous assemblage of objects which met the gaze of [the Sandman]247-the sandman , coupled with the deserted appearance of [the place]274-the place , produced an effect upon [his]247-the sandman hardy but superstitious nature . Looking round , [he]247-the sandman beheld huge mill - stones , enormous water - wheels , boilers of steam - engines , iron vats , cylinders , cranes , [iron pumps of the strangest fashion]275-iron pumps of the strangest fashion , a gigantic pair of wooden scales , old iron safes , old boilers , old gas - pipes , old water - pipes , cracked old bells , old bird - cages , old plates of iron , old pulleys , ropes , and rusty chains , huddled and heaped together in the most fantastic disorder . In the midst of the chaotic mass frowned the bearded and colossal head of [Neptune]83-neptune , which had once decorated the forepart of [a man - of - war]276-a man - of - war . Above it , on a sort of framework , lay the prostrate statue of [a nymph]277-a nymph , together with a bust of Fox , the nose of the latter being partly demolished , and the eyes knocked in . Above these , [three garden divinities]278-three garden divinities laid [their]278-three garden divinities heads amicably together . On the left stood [a tall Grecian warrior , minus the head and right hand]279-a tall grecian warrior , minus the head and right hand . The whole was surmounted by an immense ventilator , stuck on the end of an iron rod , ascending , like a lightning - conductor , from the steam - engine pump . Seen by the transient light of the moon , the various objects above enumerated produced a strange effect upon [the beholder]280-the beholder ’s imagination . There was a mixture of the grotesque and terrible about them . Nor was [the building]281-the building [itself]281-the building devoid of a certain influence upon [his]247-the sandman mind . [The ragged brickwork]282-the ragged brickwork , overgrown with weeds , took with [him]247-the sandman the semblance of a human face , and seemed to keep a wary eye on what was going forward below . A means of crossing from one side of [the building]281-the building to the other , without descending into the vault beneath , was afforded by a couple of planks ; though as the wall on the farther side was some feet higher than that near at hand , and the planks were considerably bent , [the passage]284-the passage appeared hazardous . Glancing round for a moment , [the Tinker]246-the tinker leaped into [the cellar]286-the cellar , and , unmasking [his]246-the tinker lantern , showed a sort of hiding - place , between a bulk of timber and [a boiler]287-a boiler , to which [he]246-the tinker invited [[his]246-the tinker companion]216-his companion . [The Sandman]81-the sandman jumped down . “ The ale [I]246-the tinker drank at [the ‘ Two Fighting Cocks ’]1434-the ‘ two fighting cocks ’ has made [me]246-the tinker feel drowsy , [Tinker]80-the tinker , ”[246-the tinker] [he]246-the tinker remarked , stretching [himself]246-the tinker on the bulk ; “ [I]246-the tinker ’ll just take a snooze . Vake [me]246-the tinker up if [I]246-the tinker snore — or ven [our]1435-our sperrit appears . ”[246-the tinker] [The Tinker]80-the tinker replied in the affirmative ; and [the other]244-the other had just become lost to consciousness , when [he]244-the other received a nudge in the side , and [[his]244-the other companion]216-his companion whispered—“He ’s here ! ”[216-his companion] “ Vhere — vhere ? ”[247-the sandman] demanded [the Sandman]247-the sandman , in some trepidation . “ Look up , and [you]247-the sandman ’ll see [him]295-a young man , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other . Slightly altering [his]247-the sandman position , [the Sandman]247-the sandman caught sight of a figure standing upon the planks above [them]294-them . It was that of [a young man]295-a young man . [His]295-a young man hat was off , and [his]295-a young man features , exposed to the full radiance of the moon , looked deathly pale , and though handsome , had a strange sinister expression . [He]295-a young man was tall , slight , and well - proportioned ; and the general cut of [his]295-a young man attire , the tightly - buttoned , single - breasted coat , together with the moustache upon [his]295-a young man lip , gave [him]295-a young man a military air . “ [He]295-a young man seems a - valkin ’ in [his]295-a young man sleep , ”[247-the sandman] muttered [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [He]295-a young man ’s a - speakin ’ to [some von unwisible]1436-some von unwisible . ”[247-the sandman] “ Hush — hush ! ”[244-the other] whispered [the other]244-the other . “ Let ’s hear wot [he]295-a young man ’s a - sayin ’ . ”[244-the other] “ Why have [you]247-the sandman brought [me]298-the young man [here]1437-here ? ”[298-the young man] cried [the young man]298-the young man , in a voice so hollow that it thrilled [his]298-the young man auditors . “ What is to be done ? ”[298-the young man] “ It makes [my]247-the sandman blood run cold to hear [him]295-a young man , ”[247-the sandman] whispered [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Vot d’ye think [he]295-a young man sees ? ”[247-the sandman] “ Why do [you]247-the sandman not speak to [me]300-the young ? ”[300-the young] cried [the young]300-the young man—“why do [you]247-the sandman beckon [me]298-the young man forward ? Well , [I]298-the young man obey . [I]298-the young man will follow [you]247-the sandman . ”[298-the young man] And [he]298-the young man moved slowly across the plank . “ See , [he]295-a young man ’s a - goin’ through that door , ”[80-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]80-the tinker . “ Let ’s foller [him]295-a young man . ”[80-the tinker] “ [I]247-the sandman do n’t half like it , ”[247-the sandman] replied [the Sandman]247-the sandman , [his]247-the sandman teeth chattering with apprehension . “ [We]302-we shall see [summat]84-summat as’ll take avay [our]302-we senses . ”[247-the sandman] “ Tut ! ”[80-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]80-the tinker ; “ it ’s only [a sleepy - valker]1438-a sleepy - valker . Wot are [you]247-the sandman afeerd on ? ”[80-the tinker] With this [he]298-the young man vaulted upon the planks , and peeping cautiously out of the open door to which [they]302-we led , saw the object of [his]298-the young man scrutiny enter [the adjoining house]303-the adjoining house through a broken window . Making a sign to [the Sandman]247-the sandman , who was close at [his]298-the young man heels , [the Tinker]80-the tinker crept forward on all fours , and , on reaching the window , raised [himself]80-the tinker just sufficiently to command the interior of [the dwelling]271-the dwelling . Unfortunately for [him]80-the tinker , the moon was at this moment obscured , and [he]80-the tinker could distinguish nothing except the dusky outline of the various objects with which [the place]274-the place was filled , and which were nearly of the same kind as those of [the neighbouring habitation]307-the neighbouring habitation . [He]80-the tinker listened intently , but not the slightest sound reached [his]80-the tinker ears . After some time spent in this way , [he]80-the tinker began to fear [the young man]298-the young man must have departed , when all at once a piercing scream resounded through [the dwelling]271-the dwelling . Some heavy matter was dislodged , with a thundering crash , and footsteps were heard approaching the window . Hastily retreating to [their]302-we former hiding - place , [the Tinker]246-the tinker and [[his]246-the tinker companion]216-his companion had scarcely regained it , when [the young man]298-the young man again appeared on the plank . [His]298-the young man demeanour had undergone a fearful change . [He]298-the young man staggered rather than walked , and [his]298-the young man countenance was even paler than before . Having crossed the plank , [he]298-the young man took [his]298-the young man way along the top of the broken wall towards the door . “ Now , then , [Sandman]81-the sandman ! ”[80-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]80-the tinker ; “ now ’s [your]81-the sandman time ! ”[80-the tinker] [The other]244-the other nodded , and , grasping [his]298-the young man mallet with a deadly and determined purpose , sprang noiselessly upon the wall , and overtook [[his]298-the young man intended victim]314-his intended victim just before [he]298-the young man gained the door . Hearing a sound behind [him]298-the young man , [the young man]298-the young man turned , and only just became conscious of the presence of [the Sandman]81-the sandman , when the mallet descended upon [his]298-the young man head , and [he]298-the young man fell crushed and senseless to the ground . “ The vork ’s done ! ”[247-the sandman] cried [the Sandman]247-the sandman to [[his]247-the sandman companion]216-his companion , who instantly came up with the dark lantern ; “ let [’s]1439-’s take [him]320-the victim below , and strip [him]320-the victim . ”[247-the sandman] “ Agreed , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ but first let ’s see wot [he]320-the victim has got in [his]320-the victim pockets . ”[246-the tinker] “ Vith all [my]247-the sandman ‘ art , ”[247-the sandman] replied [the Sandman]247-the sandman , searching the clothes of [the victim]320-the victim . “ A reader!—I hope it ’s well lined . [Ve’ll]85-ve’ll examine it below . The body ‘ ud tell awkvard tales if [any von]1440-any von should chance to peep in . ”[80-the tinker] “ Shall [we]1439-’s strip [him]320-the victim here ? ”[80-the tinker] said [the Tinker]80-the tinker . “ Now [the darkey]1441-the darkey shines on ’em , [you]320-the victim see what famous togs [the cull]1442-the cull has on . ”[80-the tinker] “ Do [you]320-the victim vant to have [us]1439-’s scragged , [fool]1443-fool ? ”[247-the sandman] cried [the Sandman]247-the sandman , springing into [the vault]322-the vault . “ Hoist [him]320-the victim down here . ”[247-the sandman] With this , [he]247-the sandman placed [the wounded man]323-the wounded man ’s legs over [his]247-the sandman own shoulders , and , aided by [[his]247-the sandman comrade]324-his comrade , was in the act of heaving down the body , when the street - door suddenly flew open , and [a stout individual , attended by a couple of watchmen]325-a stout individual , attended by a couple of watchmen , appeared at it . “ There [the villains]1444-the villains are ! ”[326-the new - comer] shouted [the new - comer]326-the new - comer . “ [They]1444-the villains have been murderin ’ [a gentleman]1445-a gentleman . Seize ’em — seize ’em ! ”[247-the sandman] And , as [he]247-the sandman spoke , [he]247-the sandman discharged a pistol , the ball from which whistled past the ears of [the Tinker]246-the tinker . Without waiting for another salute of the same kind , which might possibly be nearer its mark , [the ruffian]328-the ruffian kicked the lantern into [the vault]322-the vault , and sprang after [the Sandman , who had already disappeared]330-the sandman , who had already disappeared . Acquainted with the intricacies of [the place]274-the place , [the Tinker]246-the tinker guided [[his]246-the tinker companion]216-his companion through a hole into [an adjoining vault]334-an adjoining vault , whence [they]335-they scaled a wall , got into [the next house]336-the next house , and passing through an open window , made good [their]335-they retreat , while [the watchmen]337-the watchmen were vainly searching for [them]335-they under every bulk and piece of iron . “ [Here]1437-here , [watchmen]1447-watchmen ! ”[338-the stout individual] cried [the stout individual]338-the stout individual , who had acted as [leader]339-leader ; “ never mind [the villains]1444-the villains just now , but help [me]338-the stout individual to convey [this poor young gentleman]1449-this poor young gentleman to [[my]338-the stout individual house]1450-my house , where proper assistance can be rendered [him]1449-this poor young gentleman . [He]1449-this poor young gentleman still breathes ; but [he]1449-this poor young gentleman has received a terrible blow on the head . [I]338-the stout individual hope [his]1449-this poor young gentleman skull ai n’t broken . ”[338-the stout individual] “ It is to be hoped it ai n’t , [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , ”[340-the foremost watchman] replied [the foremost watchman]340-the foremost watchman ; “ but [them]1451-them was [two desperate characters as ever]1452-two desperate characters as ever [I]340-the foremost watchman see , and capable of any hatterosity . ”[340-the foremost watchman] “ What a frightful scream [I]86-mr. thorneycroft heard to be sure ! ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] cried [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ [I]86-mr. thorneycroft was certain somethin’ dreadful was goin’ on . It was fortunate [I]86-mr. thorneycroft was n’t gone to bed ; and still more fortunate [you]346-the poor woman happened to be comin ’ up at the time . But [we]337-the watchmen must n’t stand chatterin ’ here . Bring [the poor young gentleman]1453-the poor young gentleman along . ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] Preceded by [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , [the watchmen]337-the watchmen carried [the wounded man]323-the wounded man across [the road]209-the road towards [a small house]344-a small house , the door of which was held open by [a female servant]345-a female servant , with a candle in [her]345-a female servant hand . [The poor woman]346-the poor woman uttered a cry of horror as the body was brought in . “ Do n’t be cryin ’ out in that way , [Peggy]87-peggy , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] cried [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , “ but go and get [me]86-mr. thorneycroft some brandy . Here , [watchmen]1447-watchmen , lay [the poor young gentleman]1453-the poor young gentleman down on the sofa — there , gently , gently . And now , one of [you]346-the poor woman run to [Wheeler Street]6-wheeler street , and fetch [Mr. Howell]88-mr. howell , [the surgeon]1456-the surgeon . A stifling sound followed , and after struggling violently for respiration for a few seconds , [the patient]349-the patient opened [his]349-the patient eyes . [The Rookery]350-the rookery ! Who that has passed [Saint Giles ’s]7-saint giles ’s , on the way to [the city]351-the city , or coming from [it]350-the rookery , but has caught a glimpse , through some narrow opening , of [[its]350-the rookery squalid habitations]352-its squalid habitations , and [wretched and ruffianly occupants]353-wretched and ruffianly occupants ! [Who but must have been struck with amazement]354-who but must have been struck with amazement , that such a huge receptacle of vice and crime should be allowed to exist in [the very heart of [the metropolis]356-the metropolis]355-the very heart of the metropolis , like an ulcerated spot , capable of tainting the whole system ! Of late , the progress of improvement has caused its removal ; but whether any less cogent motive would have abated the nuisance may be questioned . For years the evil was felt and complained of , but no effort was made to remedy it , or to cleanse these worse than [Augean stables]357-augean stables . As [the place]274-the place is now partially , if not altogether , swept away , and [a wide and airy street]359-a wide and airy street passes through the midst of [its]350-the rookery foul recesses , a slight sketch may be given of [its]350-the rookery former appearance . Entering [a narrow street , guarded by posts and cross - bars]360-a narrow street , guarded by posts and cross - bars , a few steps from [the crowded thoroughfare]361-the crowded thoroughfare brought [you]362-you into a frightful region , the refuge , it was easy to perceive , of half the lawless characters infesting [the metropolis]356-the metropolis . The coarsest ribaldry assailed [your]362-you ears , and noisome odours afflicted [your]362-you sense of smell . As [you]362-you advanced , picking [your]362-you way through kennels flowing with filth , or over putrescent heaps of rubbish and oyster - shells , all the repulsive and hideous features of [the place]274-the place were displayed before [you]362-you . There was something savagely picturesque in the aspect of [the place]274-the place , but [its]274-the place features were too loathsome to be regarded with any other feeling than disgust . [The houses]366-the houses looked as sordid , and as thickly crusted with the leprosy of vice , as [[their]366-the houses tenants]367-their tenants . [Horrible habitations]368-horrible habitations [they]366-the houses were , in truth . [Many of [them]366-the houses]369-many of them were without windows , and where the frames were left , brown paper or tin supplied the place of glass ; some even wanted doors , and no effort was made to conceal the squalor within . On the contrary , it seemed to be intruded on observation . [Miserable rooms]370-miserable rooms , almost destitute of furniture ; floors and walls caked with dirt , or decked with coarse flaring prints ; [shameless and abandoned - looking women]371-shameless and abandoned - looking women ; [children without shoes and stockings]372-children without shoes and stockings , and with scarcely a rag to [their]372-children without shoes and stockings backs : these were the chief objects that met the view . Of [men]373-men , [few were visible]374-few were visible — the majority being out on business , it is to be presumed ; but where [a solitary straggler]375-a solitary straggler was seen , [his]375-a solitary straggler sinister looks and mean attire were in perfect keeping with the spot . So thickly inhabited were [these wretched dwellings]376-these wretched dwellings , that [every chamber]377-every chamber , from garret to [cellar]378-cellar , swarmed with [inmates]379-inmates . As to [the cellars]380-the cellars , [they]380-the cellars looked like dismal caverns , which a wild beast would shun . Clothes - lines were hung from [house]381-house to [house]381-house , festooned with every kind of garment . Out of [the main street]383-the main street branched several alleys and [passages]384-passages , all displaying the same degree of misery , or , if possible , worse , and teeming with [occupants]385-occupants . Personal security , however , forbade any attempt to track [these labyrinths]386-these labyrinths ; but imagination , after the specimen afforded , could easily picture [them]386-these labyrinths . It was impossible to move a step without insult or annoyance . [Every human being]387-every human being seemed brutalised and degraded ; and [the women]388-the women appeared utterly lost to decency , and made [the street]259-the street ring with [their]388-the women cries , [their]388-the women quarrels , and [their]388-the women imprecations . It was a positive relief to escape from this hotbed of crime to [the world]1457-the world without , and breathe a purer atmosphere . Such being the aspect of [the Rookery]350-the rookery in the daytime , what must [it]350-the rookery have been when crowded with [[its]350-the rookery denizens]392-its denizens at night ! Yet at such an hour it will now be necessary to enter [its]350-the rookery penetralia . After escaping from [the ruined house in [the Vauxhall Road]8-the vauxhall road]393-the ruined house in the vauxhall road , [the two ruffians]394-the two ruffians shaped [their]394-the two ruffians course towards [[Saint Giles]7-saint giles ’s ’s]395-saint giles ’s , running the greater part of the way , and reaching [the Broadway]396-the broadway just as the church clock struck two . Darting into [a narrow alley]397-a narrow alley , and heedless of any obstructions [they]394-the two ruffians encountered in [their]394-the two ruffians path , [they]394-the two ruffians entered [a somewhat wider cross - street]398-a somewhat wider cross - street , which [they]394-the two ruffians pursued for a short distance , and then struck into an entry , at the bottom of which was a swing - door that admitted [them]394-the two ruffians into [a small court]399-a small court , where [they]394-the two ruffians found [a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman ’s greatcoat , seated on a stool with a horn lantern in [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman hand and a cutty in [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman mouth , the glow of which lighted up [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman hard , withered features . This was [the deputy - porter of [the lodging - house]402-the lodging - house [they]394-the two ruffians were about to enter]401-the deputy - porter of the lodging - house they were about to enter . Addressing [him]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman by the name of [Old Parr]90-old parr , [the ruffians]262-the ruffians passed on , and lifting the latch of another door , entered a sort of [kitchen]404-kitchen , at the farther end of which blazed a cheerful fire , with a large copper kettle boiling upon it . On one side of [the room]405-the room was a deal table , round which [several men of sinister aspect and sordid attire]406-several men of sinister aspect and sordid attire were collected , playing , at cards . A smaller table of the same material stood near the fire , and opposite it was a staircase leading to [the upper rooms]407-the upper rooms . [The place]274-the place was dingy and dirty in the extreme , the floors could not have been scoured for years , and the walls were begrimed with filth . In one corner , with [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman head resting on a heap of coals and coke , lay [a boy almost as black as a chimney - sweep]409-a boy almost as black as a chimney - sweep , fast asleep . [He]409-a boy almost as black as a chimney - sweep was [the waiter]410-the waiter . The principal light was afforded by a candle stuck against the wall , with a tin reflector behind it . Before the fire , with [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman back turned towards [it]411-it , stood [a noticeable individual]412-a noticeable individual , clad in a velveteen jacket with ivory buttons , a striped waistcoat , drab knees , a faded black silk neckcloth tied in a great bow , and a pair of ancient Wellingtons ascending half - way up [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman legs , which looked disproportionately thin when compared with the upper part of [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman square , robustious , and somewhat pursy frame . [His]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman face was broad , jolly , and good - humoured , with a bottle - shaped nose , fleshy lips , and light grey eyes , glistening with cunning and roguery . [His]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman hair , which dangled in long flakes over [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman ears and neck , was of a dunnish red , as were also [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman whiskers and beard . A superannuated white castor , with a black hat - band round it , was cocked knowingly on one side of [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman head , and gave [him]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman a flashy and sporting look . [His]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman particular vocation was made manifest by the number of dogs [he]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman had about [him]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman . [A beautiful black - and - tan spaniel , of Charles the Second ’s breed]413-a beautiful black - and - tan spaniel , of charles the second ’s breed , popped its short snubby nose and long silken ears out of each coat - pocket . A pug was thrust into [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman breast , and [he]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman carried an exquisite Blenheim under either arm . [This person]415-this person , it need scarcely be said , was [a dog - fancier]416-a dog - fancier , or , in other words , a dealer in , and [a stealer of , dogs]417-a stealer of , dogs , as well as a practiser of all the tricks connected with that nefarious trade . [His]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman self - satisfied air made it evident [he]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman thought [himself]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman [a smart , clever fellow,—and adroit and knavish]418-a smart , clever fellow,—and adroit and knavish [he]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman was , no doubt,—while [his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman droll , plausible , and rather winning manners helped [him]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman materially to impose upon [[his]400-a dwarfish person wrapped in a tattered watchman customers]419-his customers . The law is favourable to [you]92-ginger , and the beaks is afeerd to touch [you]92-ginger . [I]246-the tinker think [I]246-the tinker shall turn dog - fancier [myself]246-the tinker . ”[246-the tinker] “ It ’s a good business , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger , “ but it requires a hedication . As [I]92-ginger wos sayin ’ , [we]1478-we gets a high price sometimes for restorin ’ a favourite , especially [ven]1480-ven ve’ve [a soft - hearted lady]1481-a soft - hearted lady to deal vith . There ’s [some vimen]1482-some vimen as fond o ’ dogs as o ’ [[their]1482-some vimen own childer]1483-their own childer , and ven ve gets one o ’ [their]1482-some vimen precious pets , [ve]1480-ven makes [’em]1480-ven ransom it as the brigands [you]92-ginger see at [the Adelphi]10-the adelphi or [the Surrey]11-the surrey sarves [[their]1482-some vimen prisoners]1484-their prisoners , threatenin ’ to send first an ear , and then a paw , or a tail , and so on . [I]92-ginger ’ll tell [you]92-ginger wot happened t’other day . There wos [a lady]1485-a lady — a [Miss Vite]95-miss vite — as was desperate fond of [her]1485-a lady dog . It wos a ugly warmint , but no matter for that — [the creater]1486-the creater had gained [her]1485-a lady heart . [Vell]82-vell , [she]1485-a lady lost it ; and , somehow or other , [I]92-ginger found it . [She]1485-a lady vos in great trouble , and [a friend o ’ mine]1487-a friend o ’ mine calls to say [she]1485-a lady can have the dog agin , but [she]1485-a lady must pay eight pound for it . [She]1485-a lady thinks [this dear]1488-this dear , and [a friend o ’ [her]1485-a lady own]1489-a friend o ’ her own adwises [her]1485-a lady to wait , sayin ’ better terms will be offered ; so [I]92-ginger sends [vord]1490-vord by [[my]92-ginger friend]1491-my friend that if [she]1485-a lady do n’t come down at once the poor animal ’s throat vill be cut that werry night . ”[92-ginger] “ Ha!—ha!—ha ! ”[450-the others] laughed [the others]450-the others . “ [Vell]82-vell , [she]1485-a lady sent four pound , and [I]92-ginger put up with it , ”[92-ginger] pursued [Ginger]92-ginger ; “ but about a month arterwards [she]1485-a lady loses [her]1485-a lady favourite agin , and , strange to say , [I]246-the tinker finds it . The same game is played over agin , and [she]1485-a lady comes down with another four pound . But [she]1485-a lady takes care this time that [I]246-the tinker sha n’t repeat the trick ; for no sooner does [she]1485-a lady obtain persession of [her]1485-a lady favourite than [she]1485-a lady embarks in [the steamer]1492-the steamer for [France]12-france , in the hope of keeping [her]1485-a lady dog safe [there]1493-there . ”[246-the tinker] “ Oh ! [Miss Bailey]96-miss bailey , unfortinate [Miss Bailey!—Fol - de - riddle - tol - ol - lol]97-miss bailey!—fol - de - riddle - tol - ol - lol — unfortinate [Miss Bailey]96-miss bailey ! ”[246-the tinker] sang [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ But there ’s dog - fanciers in [France]12-france , ai n’t there ? ”[247-the sandman] asked [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Lor ’ bless ‘ ee , yes , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger ; “ there ’s as many fanciers [i]92-ginger ’ [France]12-france as here . [Vy]92-ginger , [ve]92-ginger drives a smartish trade wi ’ [them]1494-them through [them]1494-them [foreign steamers]1495-foreign steamers . There ’s scarcely [a steamer]1496-a steamer as leaves [the port o ’]1497-the port o ’ [London]13-london but takes out [a cargo o ’ dogs]1498-a cargo o ’ dogs . [Ve]92-ginger sells ’em to [the stewards]1499-the stewards , [stokers]1500-stokers , and [sailors]1501-sailors — cheap — and [no questins asked]1502-no questins asked . [They]1494-them goes to [Ostend]14-ostend , [Antverp]15-antverp , [Rotterdam]16-rotterdam , [Hamburg]17-hamburg , and sometimes to [Havre]18-havre . There ’s a Mounseer Coqquilu as comes over to buy dogs , and [ve]92-ginger takes ’em to [him]1503-him at [a house near [Billinsgit market]1505-billinsgit market]1504-a house near billinsgit market . ”[92-ginger] “ Then [you]92-ginger ’re alvays sure o ’ [a ready market]1506-a ready market somehow , ”[247-the sandman] observed [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [Sartin]98-sartin , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger , “ cos the law ’s so kind to [us]1507-us . [Vy]99-vy , bless [you]92-ginger , [a perliceman]1508-a perliceman ca n’t detain [us]1507-us , even if [he]1508-a perliceman knows ve’ve a stolen dog in [our]1507-us persession , and [ve]92-ginger svears it ’s [our]1507-us own ; and yet [he]1508-a perliceman ’d stop [you]92-ginger in a minnit if [he]1508-a perliceman seed [you]92-ginger with a suspicious - lookin ’ bundle under [your]92-ginger arm . Now , jist to show [you]92-ginger the difference atwixt the two perfessions:—I steals a dog — walue , maybe , fifty pound , or p’raps more . Even if [I]92-ginger ’m catched [i]92-ginger ’ the fact [I]92-ginger may get fined twenty pound , or have six months ’ imprisonment ; vile , if [you]92-ginger steals an old fogle , walue three fardens , [you]92-ginger ’ll get seven years abroad , to a dead certainty . ”[92-ginger] “ That seems hard on [us]1507-us , ”[81-the sandman] observed [the Sandman]81-the sandman reflectively . “ It ’s the law ! ”[92-ginger] exclaimed [Ginger]92-ginger triumphantly . “ Now , [ve]92-ginger generally escapes by payin ’ the fine , ‘ cos [[our]1507-us pals]1509-our pals goes and steals more dogs to raise the money . [Ve alvays]100-ve stands by [each other]1510-each other . There ’s a reg’lar horganisation among [us]1507-us ; so [ve]92-ginger can [alvays]94-alvays bring [vitnesses]1511-vitnesses to svear vot ve likes , and ve so puzzles the beaks , that the case gets dismissed , and [the constable]1512-the constable says , ‘ [Vich party]1513-vich party shall [I]92-ginger give the dog to , [your]92-ginger vorship ? ’ Upon vich , the beak replies , a - shakin ’ of [his]92-ginger vise noddle , ‘ Give it to [the person in whose persession it was found]1514-the person in whose persession it was found . [I]92-ginger have nuffin ’ more to do vith it . ’ In course the dog is delivered up to [us]1507-us . ”[92-ginger] “ The law seems made for [dog - fanciers]1515-dog - fanciers , ”[246-the tinker] remarked [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ Wot d’ye think o ’ this ? ”[246-the tinker] pursued [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [I]247-the sandman wos a - standin ’ at [the corner o ’ [Gray ’s Inn Lane]19-gray ’s inn lane]1516-the corner o ’ gray ’s inn lane vith [some o ’ [[my]247-the sandman pals]1518-my pals near [a coach - stand]1519-a coach - stand]1517-some o ’ my pals near a coach - stand , ven [a lady]1485-a lady passes by vith this here dog — an ’ [a beauty it]1521-a beauty it is , [a real long - eared Charley]1522-a real long - eared charley — a follerin ’ of [her]1485-a lady . [Vell]82-vell , the moment [I]247-the sandman spies it , [I]247-the sandman unties [my]247-the sandman apron , whips up the dog , and covers it up in a trice . [Vell]82-vell , [the lady]1523-the lady sees [me]247-the sandman , an ’ gives [me]247-the sandman in charge to [a perliceman]1508-a perliceman . But that si’nifies nuffin ’ . [I]247-the sandman brings [six vitnesses]1525-six vitnesses to svear the dog vos mine , and [I]247-the sandman actually had it since it vos [a blind little puppy]1526-a blind little puppy ; and , wot ’s more , [I]247-the sandman brings [its mother]1527-its mother , and that settles the pint . So in course [I]247-the sandman ’m discharged ; the dog is given up to [me]247-the sandman ; and [the lady]1523-the lady goes avay lamentin ’ . [I]247-the sandman then plays [the amiable]1529-the amiable , an ’ offers to sell it [her]1523-the lady for twenty guineas , seein ’ as how [she]1523-the lady had taken a fancy to it ; but [she]1523-the lady von’t bite . So if [I]247-the sandman do n’t sell [it]1529-the amiable next week , [I]247-the sandman shall send it to [Mounseer Coqquilu]20-mounseer coqquilu . The only vay [you]1530-you can go wrong is to steal a dog wi ’ a collar on , for if [you]1530-you do , [you]1530-you may get seven years ’ transportation for a bit o ’ leather and a brass plate vorth a shillin ’ , vile the animal , though vorth a hundred pound , ca n’t hurt [you]1530-you . There ’s law again — ha , ha ! ”[247-the sandman] “ [Dog - fancier]1531-dog - fancier ’s law ! ”[247-the sandman] laughed [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [Some of the Fancy]1532-some of the fancy is given to cruelty , ”[247-the sandman] pursued [Ginger]92-ginger , “ and crops a dog ’s ears , or pulls out [his]1529-the amiable teeth to disguise [him]1529-the amiable ; but [I]247-the sandman ’m too fond o ’ the animal for that . [I]247-the sandman may frighten [old ladies]1533-old ladies sometimes , as [I]247-the sandman told [you]1530-you afore , but [I]247-the sandman never seriously hurts [[their]1533-old ladies pets]1534-their pets . Nor did [I]247-the sandman ever kill a dog for [his]1529-the amiable skin , as [some on ’em]1535-some on ’em does . ”[247-the sandman] “ And [you]92-ginger ’re always sure o ’ gettin ’ a dog , if [you]92-ginger vants it , [I]246-the tinker s’pose ? ”[246-the tinker] inquired [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ [Alvays]94-alvays , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [No man]1536-no man ’s dog is safe . [I]92-ginger do n’t care how [he]1529-the amiable ’s kept , ve’re sure to have [him]1529-the amiable at last . [Ve]100-ve feels [our]100-ve vay with [the sarvents]1537-the sarvents , and finds out from [them]1537-the sarvents the walley [the master]1538-the master or missis sets on the dog , and soon after that the animal ’s gone . Vith a bit o ’ liver , prepared in [my]92-ginger partic’lar vay , [I]92-ginger can tame the fiercest dog as ever barked , take [him]1529-the amiable off [his]1529-the amiable chain , an ’ bring [him]1529-the amiable arter [me]92-ginger at a gallop . ”[92-ginger] “ And do [respectable parties]1539-respectable parties ever buy dogs knowin ’ [they]1539-respectable parties ’re stolen ? ”[246-the tinker] inquired [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ Ay , to be sure , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger ; “ sometimes [first - rate nobs]1540-first - rate nobs . [I]92-ginger vant [you]246-the tinker to get [me]92-ginger jist sich [another couple]1541-another couple . ’ [Vell]82-vell , ve understands in a minnit , an ’ in doo time the identicle dogs finds [their]1540-first - rate nobs vay to [[our]100-ve customer]1542-our customer . ”[92-ginger] “ Oh ! that ’s how it ’s done ? ”[247-the sandman] remarked [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Yes , that ’s the vay , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Sometimes a party’ll vant a couple o ’ dogs for the shootin ’ season ; and then [ve]82-vell asks , ‘ [Vich]1543-vich vay are [you]246-the tinker a - goin’—into [Surrey]11-the surrey or [Kent]22-kent ? ’ And accordin ’ as the answer is given [ve]82-vell arranges [our]100-ve plans . ”[247-the sandman] “ [Vell]82-vell , [yourn]82-vell appears a profitable and safe employment , [I]247-the sandman must say , ”[247-the sandman] remarked [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Perfectly so , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [Nothin’]101-nothin’ can touch [us]100-ve till dogs is declared by statute to be property , and stealin ’ ’em a misdemeanour . And that wo n’t occur in [my]92-ginger time . ”[92-ginger] “ Let ’s hope not , ”[460-the other two] rejoined [the other two]460-the other two . “ To come back to the pint from vich [we]100-ve started , ”[246-the tinker] said [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ [our]100-ve gemman ’s case is not so surprisin ’ as it at first appears . There are [some persons]1544-some persons as believe [they]1544-some persons never will die — and [I]246-the tinker [myself]246-the tinker am of the same opinion . There ’s [[our]100-ve old deputy]1545-our old deputy here — [him]1545-our old deputy as [ve]100-ve calls [Old Parr]90-old parr — vy , [he]1545-our old deputy declares [he]1545-our old deputy lived in [Queen Bess]104-queen bess ’s time , recollects [King Charles]102-king charles bein ’ beheaded perfectly vell , and remembers the Great Fire o ’ [London]13-london , as if it only occurred yesterday . ”[246-the tinker] “ [Walker]103-walker ! ”[92-ginger] exclaimed [Ginger]92-ginger , putting [his]92-ginger finger to [his]92-ginger nose . “ [You]92-ginger may larf , but it ’s true , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ [I]246-the tinker recollect [an old man]1546-an old man tellin ’ [me]246-the tinker that [he]1546-an old man knew [the deputy]1547-the deputy sixty years ago , and [he]1546-an old man looked jist the same then as now,—neither older nor younger . ”[246-the tinker] “ Humph ! ”[92-ginger] exclaimed [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [He]1546-an old man do n’t look so old now . ”[92-ginger] “ That ’s the cur’ousest part of it , ”[80-the tinker] said [the Tinker]80-the tinker . “ [He]1546-an old man do n’t like to talk of [his]1546-an old man age unless [you]92-ginger can get [him]1546-an old man [i]80-the tinker ’ the humour ; but [he]1546-an old man once told [me]80-the tinker [he]1546-an old man did n’t know why [he]1546-an old man lived so long , unless it were owin ’ to a potion [he]1546-an old man ’d swallowed , vich [[his]1546-an old man master]1548-his master , who was [a great conjurer in [Queen Bess]104-queen bess ’s days]1549-a great conjurer in queen bess ’s days , had brew’d . ”[80-the tinker] “ [Pshaw]105-pshaw ! ”[92-ginger] exclaimed [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [I]92-ginger thought [you]246-the tinker too knowin ’ a cove , [Tinker]80-the tinker , to be gulled by such an old vife ’s story as that . ”[92-ginger] “ Let ’s have [the old fellow]1550-the old fellow in and talk to [him]1550-the old fellow , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ Here , [lazy - bones]1551-lazy - bones , ”[246-the tinker] [he]246-the tinker added , rousing [the sleeping youth]464-the sleeping youth , “ go an ’ tell [Old Parr]90-old parr ve vants [[his]1550-the old fellow company]1552-his company over a glass o ’ rum - an’-vater . ”[246-the tinker] A furious barking from [Mr. Ginger]92-ginger ’s dogs , shortly after the departure of [the drowsy youth]465-the drowsy youth , announced the approach of [a grotesque - looking little personage , whose shoulders barely reached to a level with the top of the table]466-a grotesque - looking little personage , whose shoulders barely reached to a level with the top of the table . This was [Old Parr]90-old parr . The dwarfs head was much too large for [his]90-old parr body , as is mostly the case with [undersized persons]467-undersized persons , and was covered with a forest of rusty black hair , protected by a strangely shaped seal - skin cap . [His]90-old parr hands and feet were equally disproportioned to [his]90-old parr frame , and [his]90-old parr arms were so long that [he]90-old parr could touch [his]90-old parr ankles while standing upright . [His]90-old parr spine was crookened , and [his]90-old parr head appeared buried in [his]90-old parr breast . The general character of [his]90-old parr face seemed to appertain to the middle period of life ; but a closer inspection enabled [the beholder]280-the beholder to detect in it marks of extreme old age . The nose was broad and flat , like that of an ourang - outang ; the resemblance to which animal was heightened by a very long upper lip , projecting jaws , almost total absence of chin , and a retreating forehead . [The little old man]469-the little old man ’s complexion was dull and swarthy , but [his]90-old parr eyes were keen and sparkling . [His]90-old parr attire was as singular as [[his]90-old parr person]470-his person . Having recently served as double to [a famous demon - dwarf at [the Surrey Theatre]472-the surrey theatre]471-a famous demon - dwarf at the surrey theatre , [he]469-the little old man had become possessed of a cast - off pair of tawny tights , an elastic shirt of the same material and complexion , to the arms of which little green bat - like wings were attached , while a blood - red tunic with vandyke points was girded round [his]90-old parr waist . In this strange apparel [his]90-old parr diminutive limbs were encased , while additional warmth was afforded by [the greatcoat already mentioned , the tails of which]473-the greatcoat already mentioned , the tails of which swept the floor after [him]90-old parr like [a train]474-a train . Having silenced [his]90-old parr dogs with some difficulty , [Mr. Ginger]92-ginger burst into a roar of laughter , excited by [the little old man]469-the little old man ’s grotesque appearance , in which [he]90-old parr was joined by [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; but [the Sandman]247-the sandman never relaxed a muscle of [his]247-the sandman sullen countenance . [Their]478-their hilarity , however , was suddenly checked by an inquiry from [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , in a shrill , odd tone , “ Whether [they]478-their had sent for [him]469-the little old man only to laugh at [him]469-the little old man ? ”[479-the dwarf] “ Sartainly not , [deputy]1553-deputy , ”[80-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]80-the tinker . “ Here , lazy - bones , [glasses o ’ rum - an’-vater]1554-glasses o ’ rum - an’-vater , all round . ”[80-the tinker] [The drowsy youth]465-the drowsy youth bestirred [himself]465-the drowsy youth to execute the command . The spirit was brought ; water was procured from the boiling copper ; and [the Tinker]246-the tinker handed [[his]246-the tinker guest]482-his guest a smoking rummer , accompanied with a polite request to make [himself]246-the tinker comfortable . Opposite the table at which [the party]483-the party were seated , it has been said , was a staircase — old and crazy , and but imperfectly protected by a broken hand - rail . Midway up [it]484-it stood a door equally dilapidated , but secured by a chain and lock , of which [Old Parr]90-old parr , as [deputy - chamberlain]485-deputy - chamberlain , kept the key . Beyond this point the staircase branched off on the right , and a row of stout wooden banisters , ranged like the feet of so many cattle , was visible from beneath . Ultimately , the staircase reached [a small gallery]486-a small gallery , if such a name can be applied to a narrow passage communicating with [the bedrooms]487-the bedrooms , the doors of which , as a matter of needful precaution , were locked outside ; and as the windows were grated , [no one]1426-no one could leave [[his]90-old parr chamber]489-his chamber without the knowledge of [the landlord]490-the landlord or [[his]490-the landlord representative]491-his representative . No lights were allowed in [the bedrooms]487-the bedrooms , nor in [the passage adjoining [them]487-the bedrooms]493-the passage adjoining them . Conciliated by [the Tinker]80-the tinker ’s offering , [Old Parr]90-old parr mounted the staircase , and planting [himself]90-old parr near the door , took off [his]90-old parr greatcoat , and sat down upon it . [His]90-old parr impish garb being thus more fully displayed , [he]90-old parr looked so unearthly and extraordinary that the dogs began to howl fearfully , and [Ginger]92-ginger had enough to do to quiet [them]494-them . Silence being at length restored , [the Tinker]246-the tinker , winking slyly at [[his]246-the tinker companions]420-his companions , opened the conversation . “ [I]246-the tinker say , [deputy]1553-deputy , ”[246-the tinker] [he]246-the tinker observed , “ ve’ve bin havin’ a bit o ’ a dispute vich [you]1553-deputy can settle for [us]1556-us . ”[246-the tinker] “ Well , let ’s see , ”[479-the dwarf] squeaked [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ What is it ? ”[479-the dwarf] “ Vy , it ’s relative to [your]1553-deputy age , ”[246-the tinker] rejoined [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ Ven wos [you]1553-deputy born ? ”[246-the tinker] “ It ’s so long ago , [I]90-old parr ca n’t recollect , ”[90-old parr] returned [Old Parr]90-old parr rather sulkily . “ [You]246-the tinker must ha ’ seen some changes in [your]246-the tinker time ? ”[246-the tinker] resumed [the Tinker]246-the tinker , waiting till [the little old man]469-the little old man had made some progress with [his]469-the little old man grog . “ [I]90-old parr rayther think [I]90-old parr have — a few , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr , whose tongue the generous liquid had loosened . “ [I]90-old parr ’ve seen [this great city of]1557-this great city of [London]13-london pulled down , and built up again — if that ’s anything . [I]90-old parr ’ve seen it grow , and grow , till it has reached its present size . [You]1553-deputy ’ll scarcely believe [me]90-old parr , when [I]90-old parr tell [you]1553-deputy , that [I]90-old parr recollect [this Rookery of [ours]1559-ours]1558-this rookery of ours — [this foul vagabond neighbourhood]1560-this foul vagabond neighbourhood — [an open country field , with hedges round [it]1561-an open country field , with hedges round it]1561-an open country field , with hedges round it , and trees . And a lovely spot it was . [Broad Saint Giles ’s]1562-broad saint giles ’s , at the time [I]90-old parr speak of , was [a little country village]1563-a little country village , consisting of [a few straggling houses standing by the roadside]1564-a few straggling houses standing by the roadside , and there was n’t a single habitation between [it]1561-an open country field , with hedges round it and [Convent Garden]24-convent garden ( for so the present market was once called ) ; while [that garden]1565-that garden , which was fenced round with pales , like [a park]1566-a park , extended from [Saint Martin ’s Lane]25-saint martin ’s lane to [Drury House]26-drury house , [a great mansion situated on the easterly side of [Drury Lane]27-drury lane]1567-a great mansion situated on the easterly side of drury lane , amid [a grove of beautiful timber]1568-a grove of beautiful timber . ”[90-old parr] “ [My]92-ginger eyes ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , with a prolonged whistle ; “ [the place]274-the place must be preciously transmogrified indeed ! ”[92-ginger] “ If [I]90-old parr were to describe the changes that have taken place in [London]13-london since [I]90-old parr ’ve known [it]13-london , [I]90-old parr might go on talking for a month , ”[90-old parr] pursued [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ The whole aspect of [the place]274-the place is altered . [The Thames]28-the thames itself is unlike [the Thames]28-the thames of old . [[Its]28-the thames waters]1571-its waters were once as clear and bright above [London Bridge]29-london bridge as they are now at [Kew]30-kew or [Richmond]31-richmond ; and [[its]28-the thames banks]1572-its banks , from [Whitefriars]32-whitefriars to [Scotland Yard]33-scotland yard , were edged with [gardens]1573-gardens . And then the thousand gay wherries and gilded barges that covered [its]28-the thames bosom — all are gone — all are gone ! ”[246-the tinker] “ Those must ha ’ been nice times for [the jolly young vatermen vich at [Black friars wos]1575-black friars wos]1574-the jolly young vatermen vich at black friars wos used for to ply , ”[246-the tinker] chanted [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ but [the steamers]1576-the steamers has put [their]1576-the steamers noses out o ’ joint . ”[246-the tinker] “ True , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr ; “ and [I]90-old parr , for one , am sorry for it . Remembering , as [I]90-old parr do , what [the river]208-the river used to be when enlightened by gay craft and [merry company]1578-merry company , [I]90-old parr ca n’t help wishing [its]28-the thames waters less muddy , and [those ugly coal - barges]1579-those ugly coal - barges , lighters , and [steamers]1580-steamers away . [London]13-london is [a mighty city , wonderful to behold and examine]1581-a mighty city , wonderful to behold and examine , inexhaustible in [its]13-london wealth and power ; but in point of beauty it is not to be compared with [the city of Queen Bess]1582-the city of queen bess ’s days . [You]1583-you should have seen [the Strand]223-the strand then — a line of [[noblemen]1585-noblemen ’s houses]1586-noblemen ’s houses — and as to [Lombard Street]34-lombard street and [Gracechurch Street]35-gracechurch street , with [[[their]1579-those ugly coal - barges wealthy goldsmiths]1587-their wealthy goldsmiths ’ shops]1588-their wealthy goldsmiths ’ shops — but [I]90-old parr do n’t like to think of ’em . ”[90-old parr] “ [Vell]82-vell , [I]246-the tinker ’m content vith [Lunnun]37-lunnun as it is , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker , “ ‘ specially as there ai n’t much chance o ’ [the ould city]1589-the ould city bein ’ rewived . ”[246-the tinker] “ Not much , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , finishing [his]479-the dwarf glass , which was replenished at a sign from [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ [I]92-ginger s’pose , [[my]92-ginger wenerable]1590-my wenerable , [you]1590-my wenerable ’ve seen [the king]1591-the king as bequeathed [his]1591-the king name to [these pretty creaters]1592-these pretty creaters , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , raising [his]92-ginger coat - pockets , so as to exhibit the heads of [the two little black - and - tan spaniels]505-the two little black - and - tan spaniels . “ What ! old [Rowley]106-rowley ? ”[1593-the dwarf—“often] cried [the dwarf—“often]1593-the dwarf—“often . [I]1593-the dwarf—“often was page to [[his]106-rowley favourite mistress]1594-his favourite mistress , [the Duchess of [Cleveland]38-cleveland]1595-the duchess of cleveland , and [I]1593-the dwarf—“often have seen [him]106-rowley a hundred times with a pack of dogs of that description at [his]106-rowley heels . ”[1593-the dwarf—“often] “ [Old Rowley]106-rowley wos [a king]1596-a king arter [my]92-ginger own ‘ art , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , rising and lighting a pipe at the fire . “ [He]106-rowley loved the femi - nine specious as well as the ca - nine specious . Can [you]92-ginger tell [us]1597-us anythin ’ more about [him]106-rowley ? ”[92-ginger] “ Not now , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ [I]90-old parr ’ve seen so much , and heard so much , that [my]90-old parr brain is quite addled . [My]90-old parr memory sometimes deserts [me]90-old parr altogether , and [my]90-old parr past life appears like a dream . Imagine what [my]90-old parr feelings must be , to walk through [streets]1598-streets , still called by the old names , but in other respects wholly changed . Oh ! if [you]1599-you could but have a glimpse of Old [London]13-london , [you]1599-you would not be able to endure [the modern city]1600-the modern city . The very atmosphere was different from that which [we]1597-us now breathe , charged with the smoke of myriads of sea - coal fires ; and [the old picturesque houses]1601-the old picturesque houses had a charm about [them]1601-the old picturesque houses , which the present habitations , however commodious , altogether want . ”[90-old parr] “ [You]1599-you talk like [one o ’ [them]1603-them smart chaps [they]1603-them calls]1602-one o ’ them smart chaps they calls , and [werry]1597-us properly , [penny - a - liars]1604-penny - a - liars , ”[92-ginger] observed [Ginger]92-ginger . “ But [you]1599-you make [me]92-ginger long to [ha]1605-ha ’ lived [i]92-ginger ’ those times . ”[92-ginger] “ If [you]1599-you had lived in [them]1603-them , [you]1599-you would have belonged to [Paris Garden]39-paris garden , or the bull - baiting and bear - baiting houses in [Southwark]40-southwark , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ [I]90-old parr ’ve seen [fellows]1606-fellows just like [you]1599-you at [each of [those places]1608-those places]1607-each of those places . Strange , though times and fashions change , [men]373-men continue the same . [I]90-old parr often meet a face that [I]90-old parr can remember in [James the First]107-james the first ’s time . But [the old places]1610-the old places are gone — clean gone ! ”[90-old parr] “ Accordin ’ to [your]1599-you own showin ’ , [[my]92-ginger wenerable friend]1611-my wenerable friend , [you]1599-you must [ha]1612-ha ’ lived uppards o ’ two hundred and seventy year , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , assuming a consequential manner . “ Now , doorin ’ all that time , have [you]1599-you never felt inclined to kick the bucket ? ”[92-ginger] “ Not the least , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ [My]90-old parr bodily health has been excellent . But , as [I]90-old parr have just said , [my]90-old parr intellects are a little impaired . ”[90-old parr] “ Not a little , [I]92-ginger should think , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger , hemming significantly . “ [I]92-ginger do n’t know vether [you]1599-you ’re a deceivin ’ of [us]1613-us or [yourself]1599-you , [[my]92-ginger wenerable]1590-my wenerable ; but von thing ’s quite clear — [you]1599-you ca n’t have lived all that time . It ’s not in nater . ”[92-ginger] “ Very well , then — [I]90-old parr have n’t , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr . And [he]90-old parr finished [his]90-old parr rum - and - water , and set down the glass , which was instantly filled again by [the drowsy youth]465-the drowsy youth . “ [You]1599-you ’ve seen [some picters o ’ [Old Lunnon]108-old lunnon]1615-some picters o ’ old lunnon , and [they]1615-some picters o ’ old lunnon ’ve haanted [you]1599-you in [your]1599-you dreams , till [you]1599-you ’ve begun to fancy [you]1599-you lived in those times , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Very likely , ”[109-old parr—“very] replied [Old Parr—“very]109-old parr—“very likely . ”[90-old parr] There was something , however , in [his]90-old parr manner calculated to pique [the dog - fancier]507-the dog - fancier ’s curiosity . “ How comes it , ”[90-old parr] [he]90-old parr said , stretching out [his]90-old parr legs , and arranging [his]90-old parr neckcloth,—“how comes it , if [you]1599-you ’ve lived so long , that [you]1599-you ai n’t higher up in the stirrups — better off , as [folks]1616-folks say ? ”[90-old parr] [The dwarf]479-the dwarf made no reply , but covering [his]479-the dwarf face with [his]479-the dwarf hands , seemed a prey to deep emotion . After a few moments ’ pause , [Ginger]92-ginger repeated the question . “ If [you]1599-you wo n’t believe what [I]90-old parr tell [you]1599-you , it ’s useless to give an answer , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr , somewhat gruffly . “ Oh yes , [I]246-the tinker believe [you]246-the tinker , [deputy]1553-deputy , ”[246-the tinker] observed [the Tinker]246-the tinker , “ and so does [the Sandman]247-the sandman . ”[246-the tinker] “ Well , then , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ [I]479-the dwarf ’ll tell [you]1599-you how it comes to pass . [Fate]110-fate has been against [me]479-the dwarf . [I]479-the dwarf ’ve had plenty of chances , but [I]479-the dwarf never could get on . [I]479-the dwarf ’ve been in a hundred different walks of life , but [they]1619-they always led down [hill]1620-hill . But how d’ye account for livin ’ so long ? ”[90-old parr] [he]90-old parr added , winking as [he]90-old parr spoke to [the others]450-the others . “ [I]479-the dwarf ’ve already given [you]1599-you an explanation , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Av , but it ’s a cur’ous story , and [I]80-the tinker vants [[my]80-the tinker friends]1621-my friends to hear it , ”[80-the tinker] said [the Tinker]80-the tinker , in a coaxing tone . “ Well then , to oblige [you]1599-you , [I]479-the dwarf ’ll go through it again , ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [You]1599-you must know [I]479-the dwarf was for some time servant to [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb , [an old alchemist , who lived during the reign of [good Queen Bess]104-queen bess , and who used to pass all [his]112-doctor lamb time in trying to find out the secret of changing lead and copper into gold]1622-an old alchemist , who lived during the reign of good queen bess , and who used to pass all his time in trying to find out the secret of changing lead and copper into gold . ”[479-the dwarf] “ [I]92-ginger ’ve known several indiwiduals as has found out that secret , wenerable , ”[92-ginger] observed [Ginger]92-ginger . “ And ve calls [’em smashers]1623-’em smashers , nowadays — not [halchemists]1624-halchemists . ”[92-ginger] “ [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb ’s object was actually to turn base metal into gold , ”[90-old parr] rejoined [Old Parr]90-old parr , in a tone of slight contempt . “ But [his]112-doctor lamb chief aim was to produce the elixir of long life . Night and day [he]112-doctor lamb worked at the operation;—night and day [I]479-the dwarf laboured with [him]112-doctor lamb , until at last [we]1625-we were both brought to the verge of the grave in [our]1625-we search after immortality . One night — [I]479-the dwarf remember it well,—it was the last night of the sixteenth [century,—a young man , severely wounded]1626-century,—a young man , severely wounded , was brought to [[[my]479-the dwarf master]1627-my master ’s dwelling on [London Bridge]29-london bridge]1628-my master ’s dwelling on london bridge . [I]479-the dwarf helped to convey [him]112-doctor lamb to [the laboratory]1629-the laboratory , where [I]479-the dwarf left [him]112-doctor lamb with [the doctor]1630-the doctor , who was busy with [his]112-doctor lamb experiments . [My]479-the dwarf curiosity being aroused , [I]479-the dwarf listened at the door , and though [I]479-the dwarf could not distinguish much that passed inside , [I]479-the dwarf heard sufficient to convince [me]479-the dwarf that [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb had made the grand discovery , and succeeded in distilling the elixir . Having learnt this , [I]479-the dwarf went down [- stairs]1631-- stairs , wondering what would next ensue . Half - an - hour elapsed , and while the bells were ringing in the new year joyfully , [the young man whom [I]479-the dwarf had assisted to carry [up - stairs]1633-up - stairs , and whom [I]479-the dwarf supposed at death ’s door]1632-the young man whom i had assisted to carry up - stairs , and whom i supposed at death ’s door , marched down as firmly as if nothing had happened , passed by [me]479-the dwarf , and disappeared , before [I]479-the dwarf could shake off [my]479-the dwarf astonishment . [I]479-the dwarf saw at once [he]1632-the young man whom i had assisted to carry up - stairs , and whom i supposed at death ’s door had drunk the elixir . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Ah!—ah ! ”[246-the tinker] exclaimed [the Tinker]246-the tinker , with a knowing glance at [[his]246-the tinker companions]420-his companions , who returned it with gestures of equal significance . “ As soon as [he]1632-the young man whom i had assisted to carry up - stairs , and whom i supposed at death ’s door was gone , ”[479-the dwarf] pursued [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ [I]479-the dwarf flew to [the laboratory]1629-the laboratory , and there , extended on the floor , [I]479-the dwarf found the dead body of [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb . [I]479-the dwarf debated with [myself]479-the dwarf what to do — whether to pursue [[his]1632-the young man whom i had assisted to carry up - stairs , and whom i supposed at death ’s door murderer]1635-his murderer , for such [I]479-the dwarf accounted [the young man]298-the young man ; but , on reflection , [I]479-the dwarf thought the course useless . [I]479-the dwarf next looked round to see whether the precious elixir was gone . On the table stood a phial , from which a strong spirituous odour exhaled ; but it was empty . [I]479-the dwarf then turned [my]479-the dwarf attention to a receiver , connected by a worm with an alembic on the furnace . On examining it , [I]479-the dwarf found it contained a small quantity of a bright transparent liquid , which , poured forth into a glass , emitted precisely the same odour as the phial . Persuaded this must be the draught of immortality , [I]479-the dwarf raised it to [my]479-the dwarf lips ; but apprehension lest it might be poison stayed [my]479-the dwarf hand . Reassured , however , by the thought of [the young man]298-the young man ’s miraculous recovery , [I]479-the dwarf quaffed the potion . It was as if [I]479-the dwarf had swallowed fire , and at first [I]479-the dwarf thought all was over with [me]479-the dwarf . [I]479-the dwarf shrieked out ; but there was [no one]1426-no one to heed [my]479-the dwarf cries , unless it were [[my]479-the dwarf dead master]1639-my dead master , and [two or three skeletons with which the walls were garnished]1640-two or three skeletons with which the walls were garnished . And these , in truth , did seem to hear [me]479-the dwarf ; for the dead corpse opened its glassy orbs , and eyed [me]479-the dwarf reproachfully ; the skeletons shook [their]1640-two or three skeletons with which the walls were garnished fleshless arms and gibbered ; and the various strange objects , with which [the chamber]1641-the chamber was filled , seemed to deride and menace [me]479-the dwarf . The terror occasioned by these fantasies , combined with the potency of the draught , took away [my]479-the dwarf senses . When [I]479-the dwarf recovered , [I]479-the dwarf found all tranquil . [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb was lying stark and stiff at [my]479-the dwarf feet , with an expression of reproach on [his]112-doctor lamb fixed countenance ; and the skeletons were hanging quietly in their places . Convinced that [I]479-the dwarf was proof against death , [I]479-the dwarf went forth . But a curse went with [me]479-the dwarf ! From that day to this [I]479-the dwarf have lived , but it has been in such poverty and distress , that [I]479-the dwarf had better far have died . Besides , [I]479-the dwarf am constantly haunted by visions of [[my]479-the dwarf old master]1642-my old master . [He]1642-my old master seems to hold converse with [me]479-the dwarf — to lead [me]479-the dwarf into [strange places]1643-strange places . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Exactly the case with [the t’other]1644-the t’other , ”[246-the tinker] whispered [the Tinker]246-the tinker to [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ Have [you]479-the dwarf ever , in the coorse o ’ [your]479-the dwarf long life , met [the young man]298-the young man as drank [the ‘ lixir]1646-the ‘ lixir ? ”[246-the tinker] [he]246-the tinker inquired of [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Never . ”[246-the tinker] “ Do [you]479-the dwarf happen to rekilect [his]298-the young man name ? ”[90-old parr] “ No ; it has quite escaped [my]90-old parr memory , ”[90-old parr] answered [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ Should [you]479-the dwarf rekilect it , if [you]479-the dwarf heerd it ? ”[80-the tinker] asked [the Tinker]80-the tinker . “ Perhaps [I]479-the dwarf might , ”[479-the dwarf] returned [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ but [I]479-the dwarf ca n’t say . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Wos it [Auriol Darcy]93-auriol ? ”[244-the other] demanded [the other]244-the other . “ That was the name , ”[90-old parr] cried [Old Parr]90-old parr , starting up in extreme surprise . “ [I]90-old parr heard [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb call [him]298-the young man so . But how , in the name of wonder , do [you]479-the dwarf come to know it ? ”[90-old parr] “ Ve’ve got summat , at last , ”[246-the tinker] said [the Tinker]246-the tinker , with a self - applauding glance at [[his]246-the tinker friends]523-his friends . “ How do [you]479-the dwarf come to know it , [I]479-the dwarf say ? ”[479-the dwarf] repeated [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , in extreme agitation . “ Never mind , ”[246-the tinker] rejoined [the Tinker]246-the tinker , with a cunning look ; “ [you]479-the dwarf see [I]246-the tinker does know some cur’ous matters as veil as [you]479-the dwarf , [[my]246-the tinker old file]1647-my old file .
