A piece of heavy black drapery next descended like a cloud , concealing all behind it except the hand , with which [the dwarf]479-the dwarf was suddenly seized by the nape of the neck , lifted up in the air , and , notwithstanding [his]479-the dwarf shrieks and struggles , carried clean off . Great confusion attended [his]479-the dwarf disappearance . The dogs set up a prodigious barking , and flew to the rescue — one of the largest of [them]534-them passing over the body of [the drowsy waiter]535-the drowsy waiter , who had sought [his]535-the drowsy waiter customary couch upon the coals , and rousing [him]535-the drowsy waiter from [his]535-the drowsy waiter slumbers ; while [the Tinker , uttering a fierce imprecation]536-the tinker , uttering a fierce imprecation , upset [his]80-the tinker chair in [his]80-the tinker haste to catch hold of [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ’s legs ; but the latter was already out of reach , and the next moment had vanished entirely . “ [My]92-ginger eyes ! here ’s a pretty go ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , who , with [his]92-ginger back to the fire , had witnessed the occurrence in open - mouthed astonishment . “ Vy , curse it ! if the wenerable ai n’t a - taken the pocket - book with [him]479-the dwarf ! It ’s [my]92-ginger opinion [the devil]1650-the devil has flown avay with [the old feller]1651-the old feller . [His]479-the dwarf time wos nearer at ‘ and than [he]479-the dwarf expected . ”[92-ginger] “ Devil or not , [I]80-the tinker ’ll have [him]479-the dwarf back agin , or at all events the pocket - book ! ”[80-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]80-the tinker . And , dashing up the stairs , [he]80-the tinker caught hold of the railing above , and swinging [himself]80-the tinker up by a powerful effort , passed through an opening , occasioned by the removal of one of the banisters . Groping along [the gallery]538-the gallery , which was buried in profound darkness , [he]80-the tinker shouted to [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , but received no answer to [his]80-the tinker vociferations ; neither could [he]80-the tinker discover any one , though [he]80-the tinker felt on either side of [the passage]284-the passage with outstretched hands . [The occupants of the different chambers , alarmed by the noise]541-the occupants of the different chambers , alarmed by the noise , called out to know what was going forward ; but being locked in [[their]541-the occupants of the different chambers , alarmed by the noise rooms]542-their rooms , [they]541-the occupants of the different chambers , alarmed by the noise could render no assistance . While [the Tinker]246-the tinker was thus pursuing [his]246-the tinker search in the dark , venting [his]246-the tinker rage and disappointment in the most dreadful imprecations , the staircase door was opened by [the landlord]490-the landlord , who had found the key in the greatcoat left behind by [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . With [the landlord]490-the landlord came [the Sandman]247-the sandman and [Ginger]92-ginger , the latter of whom was attended by all [his]247-the sandman dogs , still barking furiously ; while [the rear of the party]548-the rear of the party was brought up by [the drowsy waiter , now wide awake with fright , and carrying a candle]549-the drowsy waiter , now wide awake with fright , and carrying a candle . But though [every nook and corner of [the place]274-the place]550-every nook and corner of the place was visited — though the attics were searched , and all the windows examined — not a trace of [the dwarf]479-the dwarf could be discovered , nor any clue to [his]479-the dwarf mysterious disappearance detected . Astonishment and alarm sat on every countenance . “ What the devil can have become of [him]479-the dwarf ? ”[490-the landlord] cried [the landlord]490-the landlord , with a look of dismay . “ Ay , that ’s the questin ! ”[246-the tinker] rejoined [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ [I]246-the tinker begin to be of [Ginger]92-ginger ’s opinion , that [the devil]1650-the devil [himself]1650-the devil must have flown avay vith [him]479-the dwarf . [No von else]1653-no von else could ha ’ taken a fancy to [him]479-the dwarf . ”[246-the tinker] “ [I]247-the sandman only saw a hand and a black cloak , ”[247-the sandman] said [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [I]410-the waiter thought [I]410-the waiter seed a pair o ’ hoofs , ”[410-the waiter] cried [the waiter]410-the waiter ; “ and [I]410-the waiter ’m quite sure [I]410-the waiter seed a pair o ’ great glitterin ’ eyes , ”[410-the waiter] [he]410-the waiter added , opening [his]410-the waiter own lacklustre orbs to their widest extent . “ It ’s a strange affair , ”[490-the landlord] observed [the landlord]490-the landlord gravely . “ It ’s certain that [no one]1426-no one has entered [the house]1655-the house wearing a cloak such as [you]246-the tinker describe ; nor could [any of [the lodgers]1657-the lodgers]1656-any of the lodgers , to [my]490-the landlord knowledge , get out of [[their]1657-the lodgers rooms]542-their rooms . It was [Old Parr]90-old parr ’s business , as [you]246-the tinker know , to lock [’em]1659-’em up carefully for the night . ”[490-the landlord] “ [Vell]82-vell , all ’s over vith [him]90-old parr now , ”[246-the tinker] said [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ and vith [our]1660-our affair , too , [I]246-the tinker ’m afeerd . ”[246-the tinker] “ Do n’t say die jist yet , ”[92-ginger] rejoined [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [The wenerable ’s]1661-the wenerable ’s gone , to be sure ; and the only thing [he]90-old parr has left behind [him]90-old parr , barrin ’ [his]90-old parr topcoat , is this here bit o ’ paper vich dropped out o ’ the pocket - book as [he]90-old parr wos a - takin ’ flight , and vich [I]92-ginger picked from the floor . It may be o ’ some use to [us]1660-our . But come , let ’s go down - stairs . There ’s no good in stayin ’ [here]1437-here any longer . ”[92-ginger] Concurring in which sentiment , [they]559-they all descended to [the lower room]560-the lower room . A week had elapsed since [Auriol Darcy]93-auriol was conveyed to [[the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant ’s dwelling]562-the iron - merchant ’s dwelling , after the attack made upon [him]93-auriol by [the ruffians in [the ruined house]564-the ruined house]563-the ruffians in the ruined house ; and though almost recovered from the serious injuries [he]93-auriol had received , [he]93-auriol still remained [the guest of [[his]93-auriol preserver]566-his preserver]565-the guest of his preserver . It was a bright spring morning , when a door leading to [the yard]567-the yard in front of [the house]1655-the house opened , and [a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self , issued from it . [A lovelier creature than [Ebba Thorneycroft]114-ebba]570-a lovelier creature than ebba thorneycroft can not be imagined . [Her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self figure was perfection — slight , tall , and ravishingly proportioned , with a slender waist , little limbs , and fairy feet that would have made the fortune of [an opera - dancer]571-an opera - dancer . [Her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self features were almost angelic in expression , with an outline of the utmost delicacy and precision — not cold , classical regularity — but that softer and incomparably more lovely mould peculiar to [our]572-our own clime . [Ebba]114-ebba ’s countenance was a type of Saxon beauty . [Her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self complexion was pure white , tinged with a slight bloom . [Her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self eyes were of a serene summer blue , arched over by brows some shades darker than the radiant tresses that fell on either cheek , and were parted over a brow smoother than alabaster . [Her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self attire was simple but tasteful , and by its dark colour threw into relief the exceeding fairness of [her]569-a young girl , bright and fresh as the morning ’s self skin . [Ebba]114-ebba ’s first care was to feed [her]114-ebba favourite linnet , placed in a cage over the door . [Having]115-having next patted the head of a huge bulldog who came out of [his]573-his kennel to greet [her]114-ebba , and exchanged a few words with [two men employed at [a forge in the inner part of [the building on the right]576-the building on the right]575-a forge in the inner part of the building on the right]574-two men employed at a forge in the inner part of the building on the right , [she]114-ebba advanced farther into [the yard]567-the yard . This part of [the premises]578-the premises , being strewn with ironwork of every possible shape , presented a very singular appearance , and may merit some description . There were heaps of rusty iron chains flung together like [fishermen]579-fishermen ’s nets , old iron area - guards , iron [kitchen]404-kitchen - fenders , old grates , safes , piles of old iron bowls , a large assortment of old iron pans and dishes , a ditto of old ovens , kettles without number , sledge - hammers , anvils , braziers , chimney - cowls , and smoke - jacks . Stout upright posts , supporting cross - beams on the top , were placed at intervals on either side of [the yard]567-the yard , and these were decorated , in the most artistic style , with rat - traps , man - traps , iron lanterns , pulleys , padlocks , chains , trivets , triangles , iron rods , disused street lamps , dismounted cannon , and anchors . Attached to hooks in the cross - beam nearest [the house]1655-the house hung a row of old horse - shoes , while from the centre depended a large rusty bell . Near [the dog ’s kennel]583-the dog ’s kennel was a tool - box , likewise garnished with horse - shoes , and containing pincers , files , hammers , and other implements proper to [the smith]584-the smith . Beyond this was an open doorway leading to [the workshop]585-the workshop , where [the two men before mentioned]586-the two men before mentioned were busy at [the forge]587-the forge . Though it was still early , [the road]209-the road was astir with [passengers]269-passengers ; and many waggons and [carts]590-carts , laden with hay , straw , and vegetables , were passing . [Ebba]114-ebba , however , had been solely drawn forth by the beauty of the morning , and [she]114-ebba stopped for a moment at the street gate , to breathe the balmy air . As [she]114-ebba inhaled the gentle breeze , and felt the warm sunshine upon [her]114-ebba cheek , [her]114-ebba thoughts wandered away into [the green meadows in which [she]114-ebba had strayed as [a child]592-a child]591-the green meadows in which she had strayed as a child , and [she]114-ebba longed to ramble amid them again . Perhaps [she]114-ebba scarcely desired a solitary stroll ; but however this might be , [she]114-ebba was too much engrossed by the reverie to notice [a tall man]593-a tall man , wrapped in a long black cloak , who regarded [her]114-ebba with the most fixed attention , as [he]593-a tall man passed on the opposite side of [the road]209-the road . Proceeding to a short distance , [this personage]595-this personage crossed over , and returned slowly towards [[the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant ’s dwelling]562-the iron - merchant ’s dwelling . [Ebba]114-ebba then , for the first time , remarked [him]593-a tall man , and was startled by [his]593-a tall man strange , sinister appearance . [His]593-a tall man features were handsome , but so malignant and fierce in expression , that they inspired only aversion . A sardonic grin curled [his]593-a tall man thin lips , and [his]593-a tall man short , crisply curled hair , raven - black in hue , contrasted forcibly and disagreeably with [his]593-a tall man cadaverous complexion . An attraction like that of the snake seemed to reside in [his]593-a tall man dark blazing eyes , for [Ebba]114-ebba trembled like a bird beneath [their]598-their influence , and could not remove [her]114-ebba gaze from them . A vague presentiment of coming ill smote [her]114-ebba , and [she]114-ebba dreaded lest the mysterious being before [her]114-ebba might be connected in some inexplicable way with [her]114-ebba future destiny . On [his]593-a tall man part , [the stranger]599-the stranger was not insensible to the impression [he]593-a tall man had produced , and suddenly halting , [he]593-a tall man kept [his]593-a tall man eyes riveted on those of [the girl]600-the girl , who , after remaining spell - bound , as it were , for a few moments , precipitately retreated towards [the house]1655-the house . Just as [she]114-ebba reached the door , and was about to pass through [it]602-it , [Auriol]93-auriol came forth . [He]93-auriol was pale , as if from recent suffering , and bore [his]93-auriol left arm in a sling . “ [You]114-ebba look agitated , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol said , noticing [Ebba]114-ebba ’s uneasiness . “ What has happened ? ”[93-auriol] “ Not much , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba replied , a deep blush mantling [her]114-ebba cheeks . “ But [I]114-ebba have been somewhat alarmed by [the person near the gate]1663-the person near the gate . ”[114-ebba] “ Indeed ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , darting forward . “ Where is [he]1663-the person near the gate ? [I]93-auriol see [no one]1426-no one . ”[93-auriol] “ Not [a tall man]593-a tall man , wrapped in a long black cloak ? ”[114-ebba] rejoined [Ebba]114-ebba , following [him]93-auriol cautiously . “ Ha ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Has [he]1663-the person near the gate been [here]1437-here ? ”[93-auriol] “ Then [you]93-auriol know [the person [I]114-ebba allude to]1667-the person i allude to ? ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba rejoined . “ [I]93-auriol know [some one]1472-some one answering [his]1663-the person near the gate description , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol replied , with a forced smile . “ Once beheld , [the man]1669-the man [I]114-ebba mean is not to be forgotten , ”[114-ebba] said [Ebba]114-ebba . “ [He]1669-the man has a countenance such as [I]114-ebba never saw before . If [I]114-ebba could believe in the ‘ evil eye , ’ [I]114-ebba should be sure [he]1669-the man possessed it . ”[114-ebba] “ ’ Tis [he]1669-the man , there can be no doubt , ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Auriol]93-auriol , in a sombre tone . “ Who and what is [he]1669-the man , then ? ”[114-ebba] demanded [Ebba]114-ebba . “ [He]1669-the man is [a messenger of ill]1670-a messenger of ill , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol , “ and [I]93-auriol am thankful [he]1669-the man is gone . ”[93-auriol] “ Are [you]93-auriol quite sure of it ? ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba asked , glancing timorously up and down [the road]209-the road . But [the mysterious individual]604-the mysterious individual could no longer be seen . “ And so , after exciting [my]114-ebba curiosity in this manner , [you]93-auriol will not satisfy it ? ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba said . “ [I]93-auriol can not , ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Auriol]93-auriol , somewhat sternly . “ Nay , then , since [you]93-auriol are so ungracious , [I]114-ebba shall go and prepare breakfast , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba replied . “ [[My]114-ebba father]1671-my father must be down by this time . ”[114-ebba] “ Stay ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , arresting [her]114-ebba , as [she]114-ebba was about to pass through the door . “ [I]93-auriol wish to have a word with [you]114-ebba . ”[93-auriol] [Ebba]114-ebba stopped , and the bloom suddenly forsook [her]114-ebba cheeks . But [Auriol]93-auriol seemed unable to proceed . [Neither]605-neither dared to regard [the other]244-the other ; and a profound silence prevailed between [them]607-them for a few moments . “ [Ebba]114-ebba , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol at length , “ [I]93-auriol am about to leave [[[your]114-ebba father]1672-your father ’s house]1673-your father ’s house to - day . ”[93-auriol] “ Why so soon ? ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba exclaimed , looking up into [his]93-auriol face . “ [You]93-auriol are not entirely recovered yet . ”[114-ebba] “ [I]93-auriol dare not stay longer , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol said . “ Dare not ! ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba . Fortunately the silence was broken by the clinking of [the smiths]608-the smiths ’ hammers upon the anvil . “ If [you]93-auriol must really go , ”[114-ebba] said [Ebba]114-ebba , looking up , after a long pause , “ [I]114-ebba hope [we]1674-we shall see [you]93-auriol again ? ”[114-ebba] “ Most assuredly , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [I]93-auriol owe [[your]114-ebba worthy father]1675-your worthy father a deep debt of gratitude — a debt which , [I]93-auriol fear , [I]93-auriol shall never be able to repay . ”[93-auriol] “ [[My]114-ebba father]1671-my father is more than repaid in saving [your]93-auriol life , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba replied . “ [I]114-ebba am sure [he]1671-my father will be sorry to learn [you]93-auriol are going so soon . ”[114-ebba] “ [I]93-auriol have been [here]1437-here a week , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol . “ If [I]93-auriol remained longer , [I]93-auriol might not be able to go at all . ”[93-auriol] There was another pause , during which [a stout old fellow in [the workshop]585-the workshop]609-a stout old fellow in the workshop quitted the anvil for a moment , and , catching a glimpse of [the young couple]611-the young couple , muttered to [[his]609-a stout old fellow in the workshop helpmate]612-his helpmate — “ [I]114-ebba say , [Ned]116-ned , [I]114-ebba ’m a - thinkin ’ [[our]611-the young couple master’ll]1678-our master’ll soon have [a son - in - law]1679-a son - in - law . [The prisoner in [[his]1682-the prisoner in his cell cell]1683-his cell]1682-the prisoner in his cell is not restrained by more terrible fetters than those which bind [me]93-auriol to silence . ”[93-auriol] [Ebba]114-ebba gazed at [him]613-him as if [she]114-ebba feared [his]613-him reasoning were wandering . “ [You]117-john think [me]93-auriol mad , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol ; “ would [I]93-auriol were so ! But [I]93-auriol shall never lose the clear perception of [my]93-auriol woes . Hear [me]93-auriol , [Ebba]114-ebba ! Fate has brought [me]93-auriol into [this house]1684-this house . [I]93-auriol will see [her]114-ebba no more . ”[93-auriol] And instead of returning to [the house]1655-the house , [he]599-the stranger hurried away in the opposite direction of [the stranger]599-the stranger . The evening of the third day arrived , and [Auriol]93-auriol entered [Hyde Park]42-hyde park by [Stanhope Gate]43-stanhope gate . Glancing at [his]93-auriol watch , and finding it wanted nearly three - quarters of an hour of the time appointed for [his]93-auriol meeting with [the mysterious stranger]626-the mysterious stranger , [he]93-auriol struck across [the park]627-the park , in the direction of [the Serpentine River]44-the serpentine river . Apparently [he]93-auriol was now perfectly recovered , for [his]93-auriol arm was without the support of the sling , and [he]93-auriol walked with great swiftness . But [his]93-auriol countenance was deathly pale , and [his]93-auriol looks were so wild and disordered , that [the few persons]628-the few persons [he]93-auriol encountered shrank from [him]93-auriol aghast . A few minutes ’ rapid walking brought [him]93-auriol to [the eastern extremity of [the Serpentine]45-the serpentine]629-the eastern extremity of the serpentine , and advancing close to the edge of [the embankment]630-the embankment , [he]93-auriol gazed at the waters beneath [his]93-auriol feet . “ [I]93-auriol would plunge into them , if [I]93-auriol could find repose , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol murmured . “ But it would avail nothing . [I]93-auriol should only add to [my]93-auriol sufferings . No ; [I]93-auriol must continue to endure the weight of a life burdened by crime and remorse , till [I]93-auriol can find out the means of freeing [myself]93-auriol from it . Once [I]93-auriol dreaded this unknown danger , but now [I]93-auriol seek for it in vain . ”[93-auriol] The current of [his]93-auriol thoughts was here interrupted by the sudden appearance of a dark object on the surface of [the water]219-the water , which [he]93-auriol at first took to be a huge fish , with a pair of green fins springing from its back ; but after watching it more closely for a few moments , [he]93-auriol became convinced that it was [a human being , tricked out in some masquerade attire]632-a human being , tricked out in some masquerade attire , while the slight struggles which it made proved that life was not entirely extinct . Though , the moment before , [he]93-auriol had contemplated self - destruction , and had only been restrained from the attempt by the certainty of failing in [his]93-auriol purpose , instinct prompted [him]93-auriol to rescue [the perishing creature before [him]93-auriol]633-the perishing creature before him . Without hesitation , therefore , and without tarrying to divest [himself]93-auriol of [his]93-auriol clothes , [he]93-auriol dashed into [the water]219-the water , and striking out , instantly reached the object of [his]93-auriol quest , which still continued to float , and turning it over , for the face was downwards , [he]93-auriol perceived it was [an old man , of exceedingly small size , habited in a pantomimic garb]635-an old man , of exceedingly small size , habited in a pantomimic garb . [He]93-auriol also remarked that a rope was twisted round the neck of [the unfortunate being]636-the unfortunate being , making it evident that some violent attempt had been made upon [his]93-auriol life . Without pausing for further investigation , [he]93-auriol took firm hold of the leathern wings of [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , and with [his]93-auriol disengaged hand propelled [himself]93-auriol towards [the shore]638-the shore , dragging the other after [him]93-auriol . The next instant [he]93-auriol reached [the bank]639-the bank , clambered up the low brickwork , and placed [his]93-auriol burden in safety . The noise of the plunge had attracted attention , and [several persons]640-several persons now hurried to the spot . On coming up , and finding [Auriol]93-auriol bending over a water - sprite — for such , at first sight , [the dwarf]479-the dwarf appeared — [they]640-several persons could not repress [their]640-several persons astonishment . Wholly insensible to the presence of those around [him]93-auriol , [Auriol]93-auriol endeavoured to recall where [he]93-auriol had seen [the dwarf]479-the dwarf before . All at once , the recollection flashed upon [him]93-auriol , and [he]93-auriol cried aloud , “ Why , it is [[my]93-auriol poor murdered grandfather]1695-my poor murdered grandfather ’s attendant , [Flapdragon]119-flapdragon ! But no ! no!—he must be dead ages ago ! Yet the resemblance is singularly striking ! ”[93-auriol] [Auriol]93-auriol ’s exclamations , coupled with [his]93-auriol wild demeanour , surprised [the bystanders]643-the bystanders , and [they]643-the bystanders came to the conclusion that [he]93-auriol must be [a travelling showman , who had attempted to drown [[his]93-auriol dwarf]645-his dwarf]644-a travelling showman , who had attempted to drown his dwarf — the grotesque , impish garb of the latter convincing [them]643-the bystanders that [he]93-auriol had been exhibited at a booth . [They]643-the bystanders made signs , therefore , to [each other]1510-each other not to let [Auriol]93-auriol escape , and one of [them]643-the bystanders , raising [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ’s head on [his]93-auriol knee , produced a flask , and poured some brandy from it down [his]93-auriol throat , while others chafed [his]93-auriol hands . These efforts were attended with much speedier success than might have been anticipated . After a struggle or two for respiration , [the dwarf]479-the dwarf opened [his]479-the dwarf eyes , and gazed at [the group around [him]479-the dwarf]649-the group around him . “ It must be [Flapdragon]119-flapdragon ! ”[93-auriol] exclaimed [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Ah ! who calls [me]479-the dwarf ? ”[479-the dwarf] cried [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [I]93-auriol ! ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Do [you]93-auriol not recollect [me]93-auriol ? ”[93-auriol] “ To be sure ! ”[479-the dwarf] exclaimed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , gazing at [him]93-auriol fixedly ; “ [you]93-auriol are — — ”[479-the dwarf] and [he]479-the dwarf stopped . “ [You]93-auriol have been thrown into the water , [Master Flapdragon]119-flapdragon ? ”[652-a bystander] cried [a bystander]652-a bystander , noticing the cord round [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ’s throat . “ [I]469-the little old man have , ”[469-the little old man] replied [the little old man]469-the little old man . “ By [[your]479-the dwarf governor]1696-your governor — that is , by [this person]415-this person ? ”[655-another] cried [another]655-another , laying hold of [Auriol]93-auriol . “ By [him]415-this person — no , ”[479-the dwarf] said [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ [I]479-the dwarf have not seen [that gentleman]1698-that gentleman for nearly three centuries . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Three centuries , [[my]657-the man who had given him the brandy little patriarch]1699-my little patriarch ? ”[657-the man who had given him the brandy] said [the man who had given [him]479-the dwarf the brandy]657-the man who had given him the brandy . “ That ’s a long time . Think again . ”[657-the man who had given him the brandy] “ It ’s perfectly true , nevertheless , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [His]93-auriol wits have been washed away by the water , ”[659-the first speaker] said [the first speaker]659-the first speaker . “ Give [him]93-auriol a drop more brandy . ”[659-the first speaker] “ Not a bit of it , ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ [my]659-the first speaker senses were never clearer than at this moment . At last [we]1700-we have met , ”[659-the first speaker] [he]659-the first speaker continued , addressing [Auriol]93-auriol , “ and [I]659-the first speaker hope [we]1700-we shall not speedily part again . [We]1700-we hold life by the same tie . ”[659-the first speaker] “ How came [you]479-the dwarf in the desperate condition in which [I]93-auriol found [you]479-the dwarf ? ”[93-auriol] demanded [Auriol]93-auriol evasively . “ [I]479-the dwarf was thrown into [the canal]1701-the canal with a stone to [my]479-the dwarf neck , like a dog about to be drowned , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ But , as [you]479-the dwarf are aware , [I]479-the dwarf ’m not so easily disposed of . ”[479-the dwarf] Again [the bystanders]643-the bystanders exchanged significant looks . “ By whom was the attempt made ? ”[93-auriol] inquired [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [I]479-the dwarf do n’t know [the villain]1702-the villain ’s name , ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ but [he]1702-the villain ’s [a very tall , dark man]1703-a very tall , dark man , and is generally wrapped in a long black cloak . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Ha ! ”[93-auriol] exclaimed [Auriol]93-auriol . “ When was it done ? ”[93-auriol] “ Some nights ago , [I]479-the dwarf should fancy , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ for [I]479-the dwarf ’ve been a terrible long time under water . [I]479-the dwarf have only just managed to shake off the stone . ”[479-the dwarf] At this speech there was a titter of incredulity among [the bystanders]643-the bystanders . “ [You]479-the dwarf may laugh , but it ’s true ! ”[479-the dwarf] cried [the dwarf]479-the dwarf angrily . “ [We]1704-we must speak of [this anon]1705-this anon , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Will [you]667-the man who held the dwarf in his arms convey [him]1702-the villain to [the nearest tavern]1706-the nearest tavern ? ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol added , placing money in the hands of [the man who held [the dwarf]479-the dwarf in [his]667-the man who held the dwarf in his arms arms]667-the man who held the dwarf in his arms . “ Willingly , [sir]1707-sir , ”[1669-the man] replied [the man]1669-the man . “ [I]1669-the man ’ll take [him]1702-the villain to [the Life Guardsman]1708-the life guardsman , near [the barracks]1709-the barracks — that ’s the nearest public . ”[1669-the man] “ [I]93-auriol ’ll join [him]1702-the villain [there]1493-there in an hour , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol , moving away . And as [he]93-auriol disappeared , [the man]1669-the man took up [his]1669-the man little burden , and bent [his]1669-the man steps towards [the barracks]1709-the barracks . Utterly disregarding the dripping state of [his]93-auriol habiliments , [Auriol]93-auriol proceeded quickly to [the place of rendezvous]672-the place of rendezvous . Arrived there , [he]93-auriol looked around , and not seeing [any one]673-any one , flung [himself]93-auriol upon a bench at the foot of the gentle eminence on which the gigantic statue of [Achilles]120-achilles is placed . It was becoming rapidly dark , and heavy clouds , portending speedy rain , increased the gloom . [Auriol]93-auriol ’s thoughts were sombre as the weather and the hour , and [he]93-auriol fell into a deep fit of abstraction , from which [he]93-auriol was roused by a hand laid on [his]93-auriol shoulder . Recoiling at the touch , [he]93-auriol raised [his]93-auriol eyes , and beheld [the stranger]599-the stranger leaning over [him]93-auriol , and gazing at [him]93-auriol with a look of diabolical exultation . The cloak was thrown partly aside , so as to display [the tall , gaunt figure of [its wearer]676-its wearer]675-the tall , gaunt figure of its wearer ; while the large collar of sable fur with which it was decorated stood out like the wings of a demon . [The stranger]599-the stranger ’s hat was off , and [his]599-the stranger high broad forehead , white as marble , was fully revealed . “ [Our]1711-our meeting must be brief , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol said . “ Are [you]599-the stranger prepared to fulfil the compact ? ”[93-auriol] “ What do [you]599-the stranger require ? ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Possession of [the girl [I]244-the other saw]1712-the girl i saw three days ago , ”[244-the other] said [the other]244-the other ; “ [[the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant ’s daughter]1714-the iron - merchant ’s daughter , [Ebba]114-ebba . As [he]93-auriol disappeared , a moaning wind arose , and heavy rain descended . Still [Auriol]93-auriol did not quit the bench . It was about two o’clock , on a charming spring day , that [a stout middle - aged man]680-a stout middle - aged man , accompanied by [a young person of extraordinary beauty]681-a young person of extraordinary beauty , took up [his]680-a stout middle - aged man station in front of [Langham Church]46-langham church . The dog [I]92-ginger sold [him]99-vy warn’t to be compared wi ’ [Fairy]121-fairy . ”[92-ginger] “ Stuff — stuff ! ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] cried [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft ; “ [I]86-mr. thorneycroft ai n’t to be gammoned in that way . ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] “ It ’s no gammon , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Look at them ears , [miss]1733-miss — vy , they ’re as long as [your]1733-miss own ringlets — and them pads — an ’ [I]92-ginger ’m sure [you]1733-miss von’t say [she]121-fairy ’s dear at twenty pound . ”[92-ginger] “ [She]121-fairy ’s [a lovely little creature]1764-a lovely little creature , indeed , ”[114-ebba] returned [Ebba]114-ebba , again patting the animal ’s head . [I]92-ginger shall lose five pound by the transaction ; but [I]92-ginger do n’t mind it for sich [a customer]1768-a customer as [you]246-the tinker . [Fairy]121-fairy desarves [a kind missus]1769-a kind missus . ”[92-ginger] [Auriol]93-auriol , who had fallen into a fit of abstraction , here remarked : “ What ’s that [you]92-ginger are saying , [fellow]1770-fellow ? ”[93-auriol] “ [I]92-ginger vos a - sayin ’ , [sir]1707-sir , [the young lady]685-the young lady shall have the dog for fifteen pound , and a precious bargin it is , ”[92-ginger] replied [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Well , then , [I]93-auriol close with [you]92-ginger . Vere ’s [[my]92-ginger two pals]1773-my two pals , [I]92-ginger vonder ? Oh , it ’s all right ! ”[92-ginger] [he]92-ginger added , receiving a signal from behind the pillar . “ [They]1773-my two pals ’re on the look - out , [I]92-ginger see . ”[92-ginger] “ Give [the lady]1523-the lady the dog , and take the money , [man]1775-man , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol sharply . “ Beg pardon , [sir]1707-sir , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , “ but had n’t [I]92-ginger better carry the dog [home]1728-home for [the young lady]685-the young lady ? Take [my]86-mr. thorneycroft advice , [Mr. Darcy]93-auriol , and do n’t buy it . ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] “ The bargain ’s concluded , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , delivering the dog to [Ebba]114-ebba , and taking the money from [Auriol]93-auriol , which , having counted , [he]93-auriol thrust into [his]93-auriol capacious breeches pocket . “ How shall [I]114-ebba thank [you]93-auriol for this treasure , [Auriol]93-auriol ? ”[114-ebba] exclaimed [Ebba]114-ebba , in an ecstasy of delight . “ By transferring to it all regard [you]114-ebba may entertain for [me]93-auriol , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol replied , in a low tone . “ That is impossible , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba answered . “ Well , [I]86-mr. thorneycroft vote [we]1782-we drive away at once , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] said [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ [Halloa]123-halloa ! As [Auriol]93-auriol was about to follow [him]86-mr. thorneycroft , [he]93-auriol felt a slight touch on [his]93-auriol arm , and , turning , beheld [a tall and very forbidding man]711-a tall and very forbidding man by [his]93-auriol side . “ Beg pardin , [sir]1707-sir , ”[712-the fellow] said [the fellow]712-the fellow , touching [his]712-the fellow hat , “ but ai n’t [your]1707-sir name [Mr. Auriol Darcy]93-auriol ? ”[712-the fellow] “ It is , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol , regarding [him]711-a tall and very forbidding man fixedly . “ Why do [you]1707-sir ask ? ”[93-auriol] “ [I]246-the tinker vants a vord or two vith [you]246-the tinker in private — that ’s all , [sir]1707-sir , ”[246-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ Say what [you]246-the tinker have to say at once , ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [I]93-auriol know nothing of [you]246-the tinker . ”[93-auriol] “ [You]246-the tinker ’ll know [me]246-the tinker better by - and - by , [sir]1707-sir , ”[246-the tinker] said [the Tinker]246-the tinker , in a significant tone . “ [I]246-the tinker must speak to [you]246-the tinker , and alone . ”[246-the tinker] “ If [you]246-the tinker do n’t go about [your]246-the tinker business , [fellow]1770-fellow , instantly , [I]93-auriol ’ll give [you]246-the tinker in charge of [the police]1788-the police , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ No , [you]246-the tinker von’t , [sir]1707-sir — no , [you]246-the tinker von’t , ”[80-the tinker] replied [the Tinker]80-the tinker , shaking [his]80-the tinker head . Ve’re not [werry]1803-our partic’lar [ourselves]1803-our , but [ve]246-the tinker do n’t commit murder wholesale . ”[247-the sandman] “ [Ve]246-the tinker do n’t commit murder at all , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [You]246-the tinker may fancy , ”[92-ginger] pursued [the Tinker]246-the tinker , “ that [ve]246-the tinker ai n’t perfectly acvainted with [your]246-the tinker history , but to prove that [ve]246-the tinker are , [I]93-auriol ’ll just rub up [your]246-the tinker memory . Did [you]246-the tinker ever hear tell of [a gemman]1805-a gemman as murdered [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb , [the famous halchemist o ’ Queen Bess]1806-the famous halchemist o ’ queen bess ’s time , and , havin’ drank the ‘ lixir vich [the doctor]1630-the doctor had made for hisself , has lived ever since ? Here are the words : ‘ How many crimes have [I]92-ginger to reproach [myself]92-ginger with ! How many innocents have [I]92-ginger destroyed ! And all owing to [my]92-ginger fatal compact with — — ’ ”[92-ginger] “ Give [me]93-auriol that paper , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , rising , and attempting to snatch it from [the dog - fancier]507-the dog - fancier . Just as this moment , and while [Ginger]92-ginger retreated from [Auriol]93-auriol , the door behind [him]92-ginger was noiselessly opened — a hand was thrust through the chink — and the paper was snatched from [his]92-ginger grasp . Before [Ginger]92-ginger could turn round , the door was closed again . “ [Halloa]123-halloa ! It must be the devil . [I]92-ginger ’ll have nuffin ’ more to do wi ’ the matter . ”[92-ginger] “ Poh ! poh ! do n’t be so chicken-‘arted ! ”[246-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]246-the tinker . “ But come what may , the gemman sha n’t stir till [he]246-the tinker undertakes to pay [us]1820-us three hundred pounds . ”[246-the tinker] “ [You]92-ginger seek to frighten [me]93-auriol in vain , [villain]1821-villain , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , upon whom the recent occurrence had not been lost . “ [I]93-auriol have but to stamp [my]93-auriol foot , and [I]93-auriol can instantly bring assistance that shall overpower [you]92-ginger . ”[93-auriol] “ Do n’t provoke [him]246-the tinker , ”[92-ginger] whispered [Ginger]92-ginger , plucking the [Tinker]80-the tinker ’s sleeve . “ For [my]246-the tinker part , [I]246-the tinker sha n’t stay any longer . [The Tinker]80-the tinker looked nervously round . [He]80-the tinker was not proof against [his]80-the tinker superstitious fears . “ Here , take this purse , and trouble [me]93-auriol no more ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . [The Tinker]80-the tinker ’s hands clutched the purse mechanically , but [he]246-the tinker instantly laid it down again . “ [I]246-the tinker ’m bad enough — but [I]246-the tinker wo n’t sell [myself]246-the tinker to the devil , ”[246-the tinker] [he]246-the tinker said . And [he]246-the tinker followed [[his]246-the tinker companions]420-his companions . Left alone , [Auriol]93-auriol groaned aloud , and covered [his]93-auriol face with [his]93-auriol hands . When [he]93-auriol looked up , [he]93-auriol found [the tall man in the black cloak]738-the tall man in the black cloak standing beside [him]93-auriol . A demoniacal smile played upon [his]738-the tall man in the black cloak features . “ [You]599-the stranger here ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Of course , ”[599-the stranger] replied [the stranger]599-the stranger . “ [I]599-the stranger came to watch over [your]93-auriol safety . [You]93-auriol were in danger from [those men]1824-those men . But [you]93-auriol need not concern [yourself]93-auriol more about [them]1824-those men . [I]599-the stranger have [your]93-auriol pocket - book , and the slip of paper that dropped from it . Here are both . Now let [us]1825-us talk on other matters . [You]93-auriol have just parted from [Ebba]114-ebba , and will see [her]114-ebba again this evening . ”[599-the stranger] “ Perchance , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [You]93-auriol will , ”[599-the stranger] rejoined [the stranger]599-the stranger peremptorily . “ Remember , [your]93-auriol ten years ’ limit draws to a close . In a few days it will be at an end ; and if [you]93-auriol renew it not , [you]93-auriol will incur the penalty , and [you]93-auriol know it to be terrible . With the means of renewal in [your]93-auriol hands , why hesitate ? ”[599-the stranger] “ Because [I]93-auriol will not sacrifice [the girl]600-the girl , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [You]93-auriol can not help [yourself]93-auriol , ”[599-the stranger] cried [the stranger]599-the stranger scornfully . “ [I]599-the stranger command [you]93-auriol to bring [her]600-the girl to [me]599-the stranger . ”[599-the stranger] “ [I]93-auriol persist in [my]93-auriol refusal , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ It is useless to brave [my]599-the stranger power , ”[599-the stranger] said [the stranger]599-the stranger . “ A moon is just born . When it has attained its first quarter , [Ebba]114-ebba shall be [mine]599-the stranger . Till then , farewell . ”[599-the stranger] And as the words were uttered , [he]599-the stranger passed through the door . Who has not heard of [the Barber of [London]13-london]743-the barber of london ? [[His]743-the barber of london dwelling]744-his dwelling is in [the neighbourhood of [Lincoln ’s Inn]53-lincoln ’s inn]745-the neighbourhood of lincoln ’s inn . It is needless to particularise [the street]259-the street , for [everybody]1745-everybody knows [the shop]748-the shop ; that is to say , [every member of the legal profession]749-every member of the legal profession , high or low . [All]750-all , to [the very judges]751-the very judges [themselves]751-the very judges , have [their]751-the very judges hair cut , or [their]751-the very judges wigs dressed , by [him]743-the barber of london . [A pleasant fellow]752-a pleasant fellow is [Mr. Tuffnell Trigge]125-mr. trigge — [Figaro]126-figaro [himself]125-mr. trigge not pleasanter — and if [you]753-you do not shave [yourself]753-you — if [you]753-you want a becoming flow imparted to [your]753-you stubborn locks , or if [you]753-you require a wig , [I]0-i recommend [you]753-you to the care of [Mr. Tuffnell Trigge]125-mr. trigge . Not only will [he]743-the barber of london treat [you]753-you well , but [he]743-the barber of london will regale [you]753-you with all the gossip of [the court]754-the court ; [he]743-the barber of london will give [you]753-you the last funny thing of [Mr. Serjeant Larkins]127-mr. serjeant larkins ; [he]743-the barber of london will tell [you]753-you how many briefs [the great Mr. Skinner Fyne]128-the great mr. skinner fyne receives — what [the Vice - Chancellor]755-the vice - chancellor is doing ; and [you]753-you will own , on rising , that [you]753-you have never spent a five minutes more agreeably . Besides , [you]753-you are likely to see [some noticeable characters]756-some noticeable characters , for [[Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge ’s shop]757-mr. trigge ’s shop is quite [a lounge]758-a lounge . Perhaps [you]753-you may find [a young barrister who has just been “ called , ”]1827-a young barrister who has just been “ called , ”[125-mr. trigge] ordering [his]125-mr. trigge “ first wig , ”[125-mr. trigge] and [you]753-you may hear the prognostications of [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge as to [his]125-mr. trigge future distinction . “ Ah , [sir]1707-sir , ”[125-mr. trigge] [he]125-mr. trigge will say , glancing at the stolid features of [the young man]298-the young man , “ [you]1707-sir have quite the face of [the Chief Justice]1829-the chief justice — quite the face of [the chief]1830-the chief — [I]125-mr. trigge do n’t recollect [him]125-mr. trigge ordering [his]125-mr. trigge first wig — that was a little before [my]125-mr. trigge time ; but [I]125-mr. trigge hope to live to see [you]1707-sir chief , [sir]1707-sir . Quite within [your]1707-sir reach , if [you]1707-sir choose to apply . Sure of it , [sir]1707-sir — quite sure . ”[125-mr. trigge] Or [you]753-you may see [him]125-mr. trigge attending to [some grave master in Chancery]760-some grave master in chancery , and listening with profound attention to [his]125-mr. trigge remarks ; or screaming with laughter at the jokes of [some smart special pleader]761-some smart special pleader ; or talking of [the theatres]762-the theatres , [the actors]763-the actors and [actresses]764-actresses , to [some young attorneys]765-some young attorneys , or [[pupils in conveyancers]766-pupils in conveyancers ’ chambers]767-pupils in conveyancers ’ chambers ; for those are the sort of customers in whom [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge chiefly delights ; with [them]768-them , indeed , [he]125-mr. trigge is great , for it is by [them]768-them [he]125-mr. trigge has been dubbed [the Barber of [London]13-london]743-the barber of london . [[His]125-mr. trigge shop]770-his shop is also frequented by [managing clerks]771-managing clerks , [barristers ’ clerks]772-barristers ’ clerks , [engrossing clerks]773-engrossing clerks , and [others]698-others ; but these are , for the most part , [[his]125-mr. trigge private friends]775-his private friends . [[Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge ’s shop]757-mr. trigge ’s shop is none of [[your]777-your spruce West End hair - cutting establishments]778-your spruce west end hair - cutting establishments , with magnificent mirrors on every side , in which [you]777-your may see the back of [your]777-your head , the front , and the side , all at once , with walls bedizened with glazed French paper , and with [an ante - room full of bears’-grease]779-an ante - room full of bears’-grease , oils , creams , tooth - powders , and cut glass . No , [it]757-mr. trigge ’s shop is [a real [barber]781-barber ’s and [hairdresser]782-hairdresser ’s shop]780-a real barber ’s and hairdresser ’s shop , of the good old stamp , where [you]777-your may get cut and curled for a shilling , and shaved for half the price . True , the floor is not covered with a carpet . But what of that ? [It]783-it bears the imprint of [innumerable customers]784-innumerable customers , and is scattered over with [their]784-innumerable customers hair . In the window , there is an assortment of busts moulded in wax , exhibiting the triumphs of [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge ’s art ; and above these are several specimens of legal wigs . On the little counter behind the window , amid large pots of pomade and bears’-grease , and the irons and brushes in constant use by [the barber]785-the barber , are other bustos , done to the life , and for ever glancing amiably into [the room]405-the room . On [the block]787-the block is a [judge]788-judge ’s wig , which [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge has just been dressing , and a little farther , on [a higher block]789-a higher block , is that of [a counsel]790-a counsel . On either side of the fireplace are portraits of [Lord Eldon]129-lord eldon and [Lord Lyndhurst]130-lord lyndhurst . Some other portraits of [pretty actresses]791-pretty actresses are likewise to be seen . Against the counter rests a board , displaying the playbill of the evening ; and near it is a large piece of emblematical crockery , indicating that bears’-grease may be had on [the premises]578-the premises . Amongst [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge ’s live - stock may be enumerated [his]125-mr. trigge favourite magpie , placed in a wicker cage in the window , which chatters incessantly , and knows everything , its master avouches , “ as well as [a Christian]1833-a christian . ”[125-mr. trigge] And now as to [Mr. Tuffnell Trigge]125-mr. trigge [himself]125-mr. trigge . [He]125-mr. trigge is very tall and very thin , and holds [himself]125-mr. trigge so upright that [he]125-mr. trigge loses not an inch of [his]125-mr. trigge stature . [His]125-mr. trigge head is large and [his]125-mr. trigge face long , with marked , if not very striking features , charged , it must be admitted , with a very self - satisfied expression . [One]793-one can not earn the appellation of [the Barber of [London]13-london]743-the barber of london without talent ; and it is the consciousness of this talent that lends to [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge ’s features [their]795-their apparently conceited expression . A fringe of black whisker adorns [his]125-mr. trigge cheek and chin , and [his]125-mr. trigge black bristly hair is brushed back , so as to exhibit the prodigious expanse of [his]125-mr. trigge forehead . [His]125-mr. trigge eyebrows are elevated , as if in constant scorn . The attire in which [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge is ordinarily seen , consists of a black velvet waistcoat , and tight black continuations . These are protected by a white apron tied round [his]125-mr. trigge waist , with pockets to hold [his]125-mr. trigge scissors and combs ; over all , [he]125-mr. trigge wears a short nankeen jacket , into the pockets of which [his]125-mr. trigge hands are constantly thrust when not otherwise employed . A black satin stock with a large bow encircles [his]125-mr. trigge throat , and [his]125-mr. trigge shirt is fastened by black enamel studs . Such is [Mr. Tuffnell Trigge]125-mr. trigge , yclept [the Barber of [London]13-london]743-the barber of london . At the time of [his]125-mr. trigge introduction to [the reader]797-the reader , [Mr. Trigge]125-mr. trigge had just advertised for [an assistant]798-an assistant , [[his]125-mr. trigge present young man]799-his present young man , [Rutherford Watts]131-watts , being about to leave [him]125-mr. trigge , and set up for [himself]125-mr. trigge in [Canterbury]54-canterbury . In spite of [his]125-mr. trigge resolution to the contrary , [Auriol]93-auriol found it impossible to resist the fascination of [Ebba]114-ebba ’s society , and became a daily visitor at [[[her]114-ebba father]837-her father ’s house]838-her father ’s house . [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft noticed the growing attachment between [them]835-they with satisfaction . [His]86-mr. thorneycroft great wish was to see [[his]86-mr. thorneycroft daughter]839-his daughter united to [the husband]840-the husband of [her]114-ebba choice , and in the hope of smoothing the way , [he]86-mr. thorneycroft let [Auriol]93-auriol understand that [he]86-mr. thorneycroft should give [her]114-ebba a considerable marriage portion . For the last few days a wonderful alteration had taken place in [Auriol]93-auriol ’s manner , and [he]93-auriol seemed to have shaken off altogether the cloud that had hitherto sat upon [his]93-auriol spirits . Enchanted by the change , [Ebba]114-ebba indulged in the most blissful anticipations of the future . One evening [they]835-they walked forth together , and almost unconsciously directed [their]835-they steps towards [the river]208-the river . Lingering on [its]208-the river banks , [they]835-they gazed on the full tide , admired the glorious sunset , and breathed over and over again those tender nothings so eloquent in [lovers]842-lovers ’ ears . “ Oh ! how different [you]93-auriol are from what [you]93-auriol were a week ago , ”[114-ebba] said [Ebba]114-ebba playfully . “ Promise [me]114-ebba not to indulge in any more of those gloomy fancies . ”[114-ebba] “ [I]93-auriol will not indulge in them if [I]93-auriol can help it , rest assured , [sweet Ebba]114-ebba , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol replied . “ But [my]93-auriol spirits are not always under [my]93-auriol control . [I]93-auriol am surprised at [my]93-auriol own cheerfulness this evening . ”[93-auriol] “ [I]114-ebba never felt so happy , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba replied ; “ and the whole scene is in unison with [my]114-ebba feelings . How soothing is the calm river flowing at [our]1871-our feet!—how tender is the warm sky , still flushed with red , though the sun has set!—And see , yonder hangs the crescent moon . [She]114-ebba is in [her]114-ebba first quarter . ”[114-ebba] “ The moon in [her]114-ebba first quarter ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , in a tone of anguish . “ All then is over . ”[93-auriol] “ What means this sudden change ? ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba , frightened by [his]93-auriol looks . “ Oh , [Ebba]114-ebba , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol replied , “ [I]93-auriol must leave [you]114-ebba . [I]93-auriol have allowed [myself]93-auriol to dream of happiness too long . [I]93-auriol am an accursed being , doomed only to bring misery upon [those who love [me]93-auriol]1872-those who love me . [I]93-auriol warned [you]114-ebba on the onset , but [you]114-ebba would not believe [me]93-auriol . Let [me]93-auriol go , and perhaps it may not yet be too late to save [you]114-ebba . ”[93-auriol] “ Oh no , do not leave [me]114-ebba ! ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba . “ [I]114-ebba have no fear while [you]114-ebba are with [me]114-ebba . ”[114-ebba] “ But [you]114-ebba do not know the terrible fate [I]843-i am linked to , ”[843-i] [he]843-i said . “ This is the night when it will be accomplished . ”[843-i] “ [Your]114-ebba moody fancies do not alarm [me]844-she as they used to do , dear [Auriol]93-auriol , ”[844-she] [she]844-she rejoined , “ because [I]844-she know [them]1873-them to be the fruit of a diseased imagination . Come , let [us]1874-us continue [our]1874-us walk , ”[844-she] [she]844-she added , taking [his]843-i arm kindly . “ [Ebba]114-ebba , ”[843-i] [he]843-i cried , “ [I]843-i implore [you]114-ebba to let [me]843-i go ! [I]843-i have not the power to tear [myself]843-i away unless [you]114-ebba aid [me]843-i . ”[843-i] “ [I]844-she ’m glad to hear it , ”[844-she] [she]844-she rejoined , “ for then [I]844-she shall hold [you]843-i fast . ”[844-she] “ [You]114-ebba know not what [you]114-ebba do ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Release [me]93-auriol ! oh , release [me]93-auriol ! ”[93-auriol] “ In a few moments the fit will be passed , ”[844-she] [she]844-she rejoined . “ Let [us]845-they walk towards [the abbey]1875-the abbey . ”[844-she] “ It is in vain to struggle against fate , ”[93-auriol] ejaculated [Auriol]93-auriol despairingly . And [he]93-auriol suffered [himself]93-auriol to be led in the direction proposed . [Ebba]114-ebba continued to talk , but [her]844-she discourse fell upon a deaf ear , and at last [she]844-she became silent too . In this way [they]845-they proceeded along [Millbank Street]56-millbank street and [Abingdon Street]57-abingdon street , until , turning off on the right , [they]845-they found [themselves]845-they before [an old and partly - demolished building]846-an old and partly - demolished building . By this time it had become quite dark , for the moon was hidden behind a rack of clouds , but a light was seen in [the upper storey of [the structure]848-the structure]847-the upper storey of the structure , occasioned , no doubt , by a fire within [it]846-an old and partly - demolished building , which gave a very picturesque effect to the broken outline of the walls . Pausing for a moment to contemplate [the ruin]849-the ruin , [Ebba]114-ebba expressed a wish to enter [it]849-the ruin . [Auriol]93-auriol offered no opposition , and passing through an arched doorway , and ascending [a short , spiral , stone staircase]850-a short , spiral , stone staircase , [they]845-they presently arrived at [a roofless chamber]851-a roofless chamber , which it was evident , from the implements and rubbish lying about , was about to be razed to the ground . On one side there was a large arch , partly bricked up , through which opened a narrow doorway , though at some height from the ground . [With this a plank communicated]852-with this a plank communicated , while beneath [it]852-with this a plank communicated lay a great heap of stones , amongst which were some grotesque carved heads . In the centre of [the chamber]1641-the chamber was a large square opening , like the mouth of a trap - door , from which the top of a ladder projected , and near it stood a flaming brazier , which had cast forth the glare seen from below . Over the ruinous walls on the right hung the crescent moon , now emerged from the cloud , and shedding a ghostly glimmer on the scene . “ What [a strange place]1876-a strange place ! ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba , gazing around with some apprehension . “ [It]1876-a strange place looks like a spot one reads of in romance . [I]114-ebba wonder where that trap leads to ? ”[114-ebba] “ Into [the vault beneath]1877-the vault beneath , no doubt , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ But why did [we]845-they come hither ? ”[93-auriol] As [he]93-auriol spoke , there was a sound like mocking laughter , but whence arising it was difficult to say . “ Did [you]114-ebba hear that sound ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ It was nothing but the echo of laughter from [the street]259-the street , ”[114-ebba] [she]114-ebba replied . “ [You]93-auriol alarm [yourself]93-auriol without reason , [Auriol]93-auriol . ”[114-ebba] “ No , not without reason , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol cried . “ [I]93-auriol am in the power of a terrible being , who seeks to destroy [you]114-ebba , and [I]93-auriol know that [he]93-auriol is at hand . Listen to [me]93-auriol , [Ebba]114-ebba , and however strange [my]93-auriol recital may appear , do not suppose it the ravings of [a madman]1879-a madman , but be assured it is the truth . ”[93-auriol] “ Beware ! ”[114-ebba] cried a deep voice , issuing apparently from the depths of [the vault]322-the vault . “ [Some one]1472-some one spoke , ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba . “ [I]114-ebba begin to share [your]114-ebba apprehensions . Let [us]855-us quit [this place]1881-this place . ”[114-ebba] “ Come , then , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Not so fast , ”[93-auriol] cried a deep voice . And [they]855-us beheld [the mysterious owner of the black cloak]856-the mysterious owner of the black cloak barring [their]855-us passage out . “ [Ebba]114-ebba , [you]114-ebba are [mine]599-the stranger , ”[599-the stranger] cried [the stranger]599-the stranger . “ [Auriol]93-auriol has brought [you]114-ebba to [me]599-the stranger . ”[599-the stranger] “ It is false ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [I]93-auriol never will yield [her]1882-her to [you]599-the stranger . ”[93-auriol] “ Remember [your]114-ebba compact , ”[599-the stranger] rejoined [the stranger]599-the stranger , with a mocking laugh . “ Oh , [Auriol]93-auriol ! ”[114-ebba] cried [Ebba]114-ebba , “ [I]114-ebba fear for [your]93-auriol soul . [You]93-auriol have not made a compact with [this fiend]1883-this fiend ? ”[114-ebba] “ [He]1883-this fiend has , ”[599-the stranger] replied [the stranger]599-the stranger ; “ and by that compact [you]114-ebba are surrendered to [me]599-the stranger . ”[599-the stranger] And , as [he]599-the stranger spoke , [he]599-the stranger advanced towards [her]860-her , and enveloping [her]860-her in [his]599-the stranger cloak , [her]860-her cries were instantly stifled . “ [You]93-auriol shall not go ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , seizing [him]599-the stranger . “ Release [her]860-her , or [I]93-auriol renounce [you]599-the stranger wholly . ”[93-auriol] “ [Fool]1443-fool ! ”[599-the stranger] cried [the stranger]599-the stranger , “ since [you]599-the stranger provoke [my]599-the stranger wrath , take [your]599-the stranger doom . ”[599-the stranger] And [he]599-the stranger stamped on the ground . At this signal an arm was thrust from the trap - door , and [Auriol]93-auriol ’s hand was seized with an iron grasp . While this took place , [the stranger]599-the stranger bore [his]599-the stranger lovely burden swiftly up the plank leading to the narrow doorway in the wall , and just as [he]599-the stranger was passing through [it]863-it [he]599-the stranger pointed towards the sky , and shouted with a mocking smile to [Auriol—“Behold]142-auriol—“behold ! the moon is in [her]1885-her first quarter . [My]599-the stranger words are fulfilled ! ”[599-the stranger] And [he]599-the stranger disappeared . [Auriol]93-auriol tried to disengage [himself]93-auriol from the grasp imposed upon [him]93-auriol in vain . Uttering ejaculations of rage and despair , [he]93-auriol was dragged forcibly backwards into [the vault]322-the vault . One morning , [two persons]865-two persons took [their]865-two persons way along [Parliament Street]58-parliament street and [Whitehall]59-whitehall , and , chatting as [they]865-two persons walked , turned into the entrance of [Spring Gardens]60-spring gardens , for the purpose of looking at the statue at [Charing Cross]61-charing cross . One of [them]865-two persons was remarkable for [his]599-the stranger dwarfish stature and strange withered features . [The other]244-the other was [a man of middle size , thin , rather elderly , and with a sharp countenance , the sourness of which was redeemed by a strong expression of benevolence]867-a man of middle size , thin , rather elderly , and with a sharp countenance , the sourness of which was redeemed by a strong expression of benevolence . [He]244-the other was clad in a black coat , rather rusty , but well brushed , buttoned up to the chin , black tights , short drab gaiters , and wore a white neckcloth and spectacles . [Mr. Loftus]143-loftus ( for so [he]143-loftus was called ) was [a retired merchant , of moderate fortune]868-a retired merchant , of moderate fortune , and lived in [Abingdon Street]57-abingdon street . [He]143-loftus was [a bachelor]869-a bachelor , and therefore pleased [himself]143-loftus ; and being a bit of [an antiquary]870-an antiquary , rambled about all day long in search of some object of interest . [His]143-loftus walk , on the present occasion , was taken with that view . “ By [Jove]144-jove ! what a noble statue that is , [Morse]141-morse ! ”[143-loftus] cried [Loftus]143-loftus , gazing at it . “ The horse is magnificent — positively magnificent . ”[143-loftus] “ [I]141-morse recollect when [the spot]1886-the spot was occupied by a gibbet , and when , in lieu of a statue , an effigy of [the martyred monarch]1887-the martyred monarch was placed there , ”[141-morse] replied [Morse]141-morse . “ That was in the time of [the Protectorate]1888-the protectorate . ”[143-loftus] “ [You]141-morse can not get those dreams out of [your]141-morse head , [Morse]141-morse , ”[143-loftus] said [Loftus]143-loftus , smiling . “ [I]143-loftus wish [I]143-loftus could persuade [myself]143-loftus [I]143-loftus had lived for two centuries and a half . ”[143-loftus] “ Would [you]141-morse could have seen the ancient cross , which once stood there , erected by [[Edward]116-ned the First to [[his]116-ned beloved wife]1890-his beloved wife]1889-edward the first to his beloved wife , ‘ [Eleanor of Castile]145-eleanor of castile ’ ! ”[141-morse] said [Morse]141-morse , heedless of the other ’s remark . “ It was much mutilated when [I]141-morse remember it ; some of the pinnacles were broken , and the foliage defaced , but the statues of [the queen]1891-the queen were still standing in the recesses ; and altogether the effect was beautiful . ”[141-morse] “ It must have been charming , ”[143-loftus] observed [Loftus]143-loftus , rubbing [his]143-loftus hands ; “ and , though [I]143-loftus like the statue , [I]143-loftus would much rather have had the old Gothic cross . But how fortunate the former escaped destruction in [Oliver Cromwell]146-oliver cromwell ’s time ! ”[143-loftus] “ [I]141-morse can tell [you]141-morse how that came to pass , [sir]1707-sir , ”[141-morse] replied [Morse]141-morse , “ for [I]141-morse was assistant to [John Rivers]117-john , the brazier , to whom the statue was sold . ”[141-morse] “ Ah ! indeed ! ”[143-loftus] exclaimed [Loftus]143-loftus . “ [I]143-loftus have heard something of the story , but should like to have full particulars . ”[143-loftus] “ [You]141-morse shall hear them , then , ”[141-morse] replied [Morse]141-morse . “ [Yon]141-morse statue , which , as [you]141-morse know , was cast by [Hubert le Sueur]147-hubert le sueur , in 1633 , was ordered by [Parliament]148-parliament to be sold and broken to pieces . Well , [[my]141-morse master]1627-my master , [John Rivers]117-john , being [a stanch Royalist]1894-a stanch royalist , though [he]117-john did not dare to avow [his]117-john principles , determined to preserve it from destruction . Accordingly , [he]117-john offered a good round sum for it , and was declared [the purchaser]1895-the purchaser . But how to dispose of it was the difficulty ? [He]117-john could trust [none of [[his]117-john men]1897-his men but [me]141-morse , whom [he]117-john knew to be as hearty a hater of [the Roundheads]149-the roundheads , and as loyal to the memory of [[our]1898-our slaughtered sovereign]1899-our slaughtered sovereign , as [himself]117-john]1896-none of his men but me , whom he knew to be as hearty a hater of the roundheads , and as loyal to the memory of our slaughtered sovereign , as himself . Well , [we]1898-our digged a great pit , secretly , in [the cellar]286-the cellar , whither the statue had been conveyed , and buried [it]1899-our slaughtered sovereign . The job occupied [us]1898-our nearly a month ; and during that time , [[my]141-morse master]1627-my master collected together all the pieces of old brass [he]117-john could procure . These [he]117-john afterwards produced , and declared they were the fragments of the statue . But the cream of the jest was to come . [He]117-john began to cast handles of knives and forks in brass , giving it out that they were made from the metal of the statue . And plenty of ’em [he]117-john sold too , for [the Cavaliers]1902-the cavaliers bought ’em as memorials of [[their]1902-the cavaliers martyred monarch]1903-their martyred monarch , and the Roundheads as evidences of [his]117-john fall . In this way [he]117-john soon got back [his]117-john outlay . ”[141-morse] “ Ha ! ha ! ha ! ”[143-loftus] laughed [Loftus]143-loftus . “ Well , in due season came the Restoration , ”[143-loftus] pursued [Morse]141-morse ; “ and [[my]143-loftus master]1627-my master made known to [King Charles]102-king charles the Second the treasure [he]117-john had kept concealed for [him]117-john . ”[561-the iron - merchant] “ Exactly , [sir]1707-sir , ”[507-the dog - fancier] replied [the dog - fancier]507-the dog - fancier , again touching [his]507-the dog - fancier hat , “ ex - actly . In this state [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft heard [the Tinker]80-the tinker and [the Sandman]247-the sandman take [their]942-their places near [him]86-mr. thorneycroft , but not remarking the voice of [Reeks]164-reeks , concluded that [he]86-mr. thorneycroft must have got outside . The next moment , [the coach]710-the coach was put in motion , and rattled over the stones at a rapid pace . It made many turns ; but at length proceeded steadily onwards , while from the profound silence around , and the greater freshness of the air , [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft began to fancy [they]944-they had gained [the country]945-the country . Not a word was spoken by [any one]673-any one during the ride . After a while , [the coach]710-the coach stopped , the door was opened , and [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft was helped out . [The iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant expected [his]86-mr. thorneycroft bandage would now be removed , but [he]561-the iron - merchant was mistaken , for [Reeks]164-reeks , taking [his]86-mr. thorneycroft arm , drew [him]86-mr. thorneycroft along at a quick pace . As [they]944-they advanced , [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant ’s conductor whispered [him]86-mr. thorneycroft to be cautious , and , at the same time , made [him]86-mr. thorneycroft keep close to a wall . A door was presently opened , and as soon as [the party had passed through]950-the party had passed through , it closed . The bandage was then removed from [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft ’s eyes , and [he]86-mr. thorneycroft found [himself]86-mr. thorneycroft in [a large and apparently neglected garden]951-a large and apparently neglected garden . Though the sky was cloudy , there was light enough to enable [him]86-mr. thorneycroft to distinguish that [they]944-they were near [an old dilapidated mansion]952-an old dilapidated mansion . “ [We]944-they are now arrived , ”[164-reeks] said [Reeks]164-reeks to [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant , “ and [you]86-mr. thorneycroft will have need of all [your]86-mr. thorneycroft resolution . ”[164-reeks] “ [I]86-mr. thorneycroft will deliver [her]1977-her , or perish in the attempt , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] said [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , taking out [his]86-mr. thorneycroft pistols . [The others]450-the others drew [their]450-the others cutlasses . “ Now then , follow [me]164-reeks , ”[164-reeks] said [Reeks]164-reeks , “ and act as [I]164-reeks direct . ”[164-reeks] With this [he]164-reeks struck into [an alley formed by thick hedges of privet]955-an alley formed by thick hedges of privet , which brought [them]944-they to the back part of [the house]1655-the house .
