[Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft and [[his]86-mr. thorneycroft companions]420-his companions had scarcely gained a passage in [the deserted house]1173-the deserted house , which [they]1174-they had entered in the manner described in a previous chapter , when [they]1174-they were alarmed by the sudden and furious ringing of a bell overhead . The noise brought [them]1174-they instantly to a halt , and [each man]1175-each man grasped [his]1175-each man arms in expectation of an attack , but the peal ceasing in a few moments , and all continuing quiet , [they]1174-they moved on as before , and presently reached [a large hall]1176-a large hall with a lofty window over the door , which , being without shutters , afforded light enough to reveal the dilapidated condition of [the mansion]1177-the mansion . From [this hall]1178-this hall four side doors opened , apparently communicating with different chambers , three of which were cautiously tried by [Reeks]164-reeks , but they proved to be fastened . The fourth , however , yielded to [his]86-mr. thorneycroft touch , and admitted [them]1174-they to [a chamber]1179-a chamber , which seemed to have been recently occupied , for a lamp was burning within [it]1179-a chamber . The walls were panelled with dusky oak , and hung at the lower end with tapestry , representing [the Assyrian monarch Ninus]1180-the assyrian monarch ninus , and [[his]1180-the assyrian monarch ninus captive [Zoroaster]178-zoroaster]1181-his captive zoroaster , [King of [the Bactrians]1183-the bactrians]1182-king of the bactrians . The chief furniture consisted of three large high - backed and grotesquely - carved arm - chairs , near one of which stood a powerful electrical machine . Squares and circles were traced upon the floor , and here and there were scattered cups and balls , and other matters apparently belonging to a conjuring apparatus . [The room]405-the room might be the retreat of [a man of science]1185-a man of science , or it might be the repository of [a juggler]1186-a juggler . But whoever [its occupant]1187-its occupant was , and whatsoever [his]1187-its occupant pursuits , the good things of [the world]1457-the world were not altogether neglected by [him]1187-its occupant , as was proved by a table spread with viands , and furnished with glasses , together with a couple of taper - necked bottles . While glancing upwards , [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft remarked that just above each chair the ceiling was pierced with a round hole , the meaning of which [he]86-mr. thorneycroft could not at the time comprehend , though after circumstances sufficiently explained it to [him]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ [A singular room]2070-a singular room , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] [he]86-mr. thorneycroft observed to [Reeks]164-reeks , on concluding [his]164-reeks survey . “ Did [you]164-reeks expect to find [any one]673-any one [here]1437-here ? ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] “ [I]244-the other hardly know , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other . “ That bell may have given the alarm . But [I]244-the other will soon ascertain the point . Remain [here]1437-here till [I]244-the other return . ”[244-the other] “ [You]164-reeks are not going to leave [us]2074-us ? ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] rejoined [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft uneasily . “ Only for a moment , ”[164-reeks] said [Reeks]164-reeks . “ Keep quiet , and no harm will befall [you]164-reeks . Whatever [you]164-reeks may hear without , do not stir . ”[164-reeks] “ What are [we]2074-us likely to hear ? ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] asked [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft with increasing trepidation . “ That ’s impossible to say , ”[164-reeks] answered [Reeks]164-reeks ; “ but [I]164-reeks warn [you]164-reeks not to cry out unnecessarily , as such an imprudence would endanger [our]2074-us safety . ”[164-reeks] “ [You]164-reeks are quite sure [you]164-reeks do n’t mean to abandon [us]2074-us ? ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] persisted [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ Make [yourself]164-reeks easy ; [I]164-reeks have no such intention , ”[164-reeks] rejoined [Reeks]164-reeks sternly . “ Oh ! ve’ll take care on [you]164-reeks , do n’t be afeerd , [old gent]2075-old gent , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Yes , ve’ll take care on [you]164-reeks , ”[92-ginger] added [the Tinker]80-the tinker and [the Sandman]247-the sandman . “ [You]164-reeks may depend upon [them]2076-them as upon [me]164-reeks , [sir]1707-sir , ”[164-reeks] said [Reeks]164-reeks . “ Before [we]2078-we explore [the subterranean apartments]2079-the subterranean apartments , [I]164-reeks wish to see whether any one is up - stairs . ”[164-reeks] “ Wot ’s that [you]164-reeks say about [subterranean apartments]2080-subterranean apartments , [Mr. Reeks]164-reeks ? ”[92-ginger] interposed [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Ve ai n’t a - goin’ below , eh ? ”[92-ginger] But without paying any attention to the inquiry , [Reeks]164-reeks quitted [the room]405-the room , and closed the door carefully after [him]164-reeks . [He]164-reeks next crossed [the hall]1020-the hall , and cautiously ascending a staircase at the farther end of [it]1020-the hall , reached [the landing - place]1193-the landing - place . Beyond [it]1020-the hall was [a gallery]1017-a gallery , from which [several chambers]1195-several chambers opened . Advancing a few paces , [he]164-reeks listened intently , and hearing a slight sound in [an apartment to the right]1196-an apartment to the right , [he]164-reeks stepped softly towards [it]1196-an apartment to the right , and placing [his]164-reeks eye to the keyhole , beheld [a tall man , dressed in black , pacing to and fro with rapid strides]1197-a tall man , dressed in black , pacing to and fro with rapid strides , while [three other persons , wrapped in sable gowns , and disguised with hideous masks]1198-three other persons , wrapped in sable gowns , and disguised with hideous masks , stood silent and motionless at a little distance from [him]164-reeks . In [the tall man]619-the tall man [he]164-reeks recognised [Cyprian Rougemont]167-rougemont . Upon a table in the middle of [the room]405-the room was laid a large open volume , bound in black vellum . Near it stood a lamp , which served to illumine the scene . Suddenly , [Rougemont]167-rougemont stopped , and turning over several leaves of the book , which were covered with cabalistic characters , appeared in search of some magic formula . Before [he]167-rougemont could find it , however , a startling interruption occurred . An alarum - bell , fixed against the wall , began to ring , and at the same moment the doors of a cabinet flew open , and a large ape ( for such it seemed to [Reeks]164-reeks ) , clothed in a woollen shirt and drawers , sprang forth , and bounding upon the table beside [Rougemont]167-rougemont , placed its mouth to [his]167-rougemont ear . The communication thus strangely made seemed highly displeasing to [Rougemont]167-rougemont , who knitted [his]167-rougemont brows , and delivered some instructions in an undertone to the monkey . The animal nodded its head in token of obedience , jumped off the table , and bounded back to the cabinet , the doors of which closed as before . [Rougemont]167-rougemont next took up the lamp , with the evident intention of quitting [the room]405-the room , seeing which , [Reeks]164-reeks hastily retreated to [an adjoining chamber]1202-an adjoining chamber , the door of which was fortunately open , and had scarcely gained its shelter when [the four mysterious personages]1203-the four mysterious personages appeared on [the gallery]538-the gallery . [Reeks]164-reeks heard [their]1203-the four mysterious personages footsteps descending the staircase , and then , creeping cautiously after [them]1203-the four mysterious personages , watched [them]1203-the four mysterious personages across [the hall]1020-the hall , and pause before [the chamber containing [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft and [[his]86-mr. thorneycroft companions]420-his companions]1206-the chamber containing mr. thorneycroft and his companions . After a moment ’s deliberation , [Rougemont]167-rougemont noiselessly locked the door , took out the key , and leaving [two of [[his]167-rougemont attendants]1209-his attendants on guard]1208-two of his attendants on guard , returned with [the third]1210-the third towards [the staircase]532-the staircase . Without tarrying to confront [them]1203-the four mysterious personages , [Reeks]164-reeks started back , and hurried along [the gallery]538-the gallery till [he]164-reeks came to a back staircase , which conducted [him]164-reeks , by various descents , to [the basement floor]1213-the basement floor , where , after traversing [one or two vaults]1214-one or two vaults , [he]164-reeks entered [a subterranean passage]1215-a subterranean passage , arched overhead , and having several openings at the sides , apparently communicating with [other passages]1216-other passages . [It]1215-a subterranean passage was lighted at intervals by lamps , which emitted a feeble radiance . By the light of one of these , [Reeks]164-reeks discovered the door of [a cell]1217-a cell . It was of iron , and as [he]164-reeks struck it with [his]164-reeks hand , returned a hollow clangour . On repeating the blow , a hoarse voice from within cried , “ Leave [me]93-auriol in peace ! ”[93-auriol] “ Is it [Auriol]93-auriol Darcy who speaks ? ”[164-reeks] demanded [Reeks]164-reeks . “ It is , ”[1218-the prisoner] replied [the prisoner]1218-the prisoner . “ Who are [you]164-reeks that put the question ? ”[1218-the prisoner] “ [A friend]1853-a friend , ”[164-reeks] replied [Reeks]164-reeks . “ [I]93-auriol have [no friend]2082-no friend here , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [You]164-reeks are mistaken , ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Reeks]164-reeks . “ [I]93-auriol have come with [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft to deliver [you]164-reeks . ”[93-auriol] “ [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft has come too late . [He]86-mr. thorneycroft has lost [[his]86-mr. thorneycroft daughter]839-his daughter , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ What has happened to [her]839-his daughter ? ”[164-reeks] demanded [Reeks]164-reeks . “ [She]839-his daughter is in the power of [the Fiend]1979-the fiend , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [I]164-reeks know [she]839-his daughter is detained by [Cyprian Rougemont]167-rougemont , ”[164-reeks] said [Reeks]164-reeks . “ But what has befallen [her]839-his daughter ? ”[164-reeks] “ [She]839-his daughter has become like [[his]167-rougemont other victims]2085-his other victims — like [[my]93-auriol victims]2086-my victims ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol distractedly . “ Do not despair , ”[164-reeks] rejoined [Reeks]164-reeks . “ [She]839-his daughter may yet be saved . ”[93-auriol] “ Saved ! how ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ All is over . ”[93-auriol] “ So it may seem to [you]93-auriol , ”[93-auriol] rejoined [Reeks]164-reeks ; “ but [you]93-auriol are [the victim of delusion]2087-the victim of delusion . ”[93-auriol] “ Oh that [I]93-auriol could think so ! ”[93-auriol] exclaimed [Auriol]93-auriol . “ But no — [I]93-auriol saw [her]839-his daughter fall into the pit . [Some one]1472-some one approaches . ”[164-reeks] More than ten minutes had elapsed since [Reeks]164-reeks ’ departure , and [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , who had hitherto had some difficulty in repressing [his]86-mr. thorneycroft anger , now began to give vent to it in muttered threats and complaints . Ven [the gent]2126-the gent urges that it was a subject of ser’ous importance to [all dog - owners]2160-all dog - owners , [the magistrit]2161-the magistrit angrily interrupts [him]2161-the magistrit , sayin’—‘Then let there be a meetin ’ of [dog - owners]2162-dog - owners to discuss [their]2162-dog - owners grievances . Do n’t come to [me]92-ginger . [I]92-ginger ca n’t help [you]1707-sir . ’ And [he]2161-the magistrit vouldn’t if [he]2161-the magistrit could , ‘ cos [he]2161-the magistrit ’s [the dog - fancier ’s friend]2163-the dog - fancier ’s friend . ”[92-ginger] “ It looks like it , [I]86-mr. thorneycroft must own , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] replied [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ Such reprehensible indifference gives encouragement to [people of [your]1707-sir profession]2164-people of your profession . [I]92-ginger ’ll drink [his]2167-the vorthy beak health a second time . ”[92-ginger] “ [Halloa]123-halloa ! wot ’s that ? ”[246-the tinker] cried [the Tinker]246-the tinker ; “ [I]246-the tinker thought [I]246-the tinker heerd a noise . ”[246-the tinker] “ So did [I]86-mr. thorneycroft , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] rejoined [the Sandman]247-the sandman ; “ a strange sort o ’ rumblin ’ sound overhead . ”[246-the tinker] “ There it goes again ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger ; “ wot an awful din ! ”[92-ginger] “ Now it ’s underneath , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] said [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , turning pale , and trembling . “ It sounds as if some hidden machinery were at work . ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] The noise , which up to this moment had borne an indistinct resemblance to the creaking of wheels and pulleys , now increased to a violent clatter , while [the house]1655-the house was shaken as if by the explosion of a mine beneath [it]1655-the house . At the same time , [the occupants of the chairs]1239-the occupants of the chairs received a sharp electrical shock , that agitated every limb , and caused [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft to let fall [his]86-mr. thorneycroft pistol , which went off as it reached the ground . At the same time , [the Sandman]247-the sandman dropped [his]247-the sandman goblet , and [the Tinker]246-the tinker relinquished [his]246-the tinker grasp of the cutlass . Before [they]1239-the occupants of the chairs could recover from the shock , [all three]1242-all three were caught by stout wooden hooks , which , detaching [themselves]1239-the occupants of the chairs from the back of the chairs , pinioned [their]1239-the occupants of the chairs arms , while [their]1239-the occupants of the chairs legs were restrained by fetters , which sprang from the ground and clasped round [their]1239-the occupants of the chairs ankles . Thus fixed , [they]1239-the occupants of the chairs struggled vainly to get free . The chairs seemed nailed to the ground , so that all efforts to move [them]1239-the occupants of the chairs proved futile . But the worst was to come . From the holes in the ceiling already alluded to , descended three heavy bell - shaped helmets , fashioned like those worn by divers at [the bottom of [the sea]1244-the sea]1243-the bottom of the sea , and having round eyelet - holes of glass . It was evident , from the manner of [their]1239-the occupants of the chairs descent , that these helmets must drop on the heads of [the sitters]1245-the sitters — a conviction that filled [them]1239-the occupants of the chairs with inexpressible terror . [They]1239-the occupants of the chairs shouted , and swore frightfully ; but [their]1239-the occupants of the chairs vociferations availed [them]1239-the occupants of the chairs nothing . Down came the helmets , and the same moment the monkey , which had been seen by [Reeks]164-reeks , issued from a cupboard at the top of a cabinet , and grinned and gibbered at [them]1239-the occupants of the chairs . Down came the first helmet , and covered [the Tinker]80-the tinker to the shoulders . [His]80-the tinker appearance was at once ludicrous and terrible , and [his]80-the tinker roaring within the casque sounded like the bellowing of a baited bull . Down came the second helmet , though rather more slowly , and [the Sandman]247-the sandman was eclipsed in the same manner as [the Tinker]80-the tinker , and roared as loudly . In both these instances the helmets had dropped without guidance , but in the case of [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , a hand , thrust out of the hole in the ceiling , held the helmet suspended over [his]80-the tinker head , like the sword of [Damocles]185-damocles . While [the poor iron - merchant]1247-the poor iron - merchant momentarily expected the same doom as [[his]1247-the poor iron - merchant companions]420-his companions , [his]1247-the poor iron - merchant attention was attracted towards the monkey , which , clinging with one hand to the side of the cabinet , extended the other skinny arm towards [him]1247-the poor iron - merchant , and exclaimed—“Will [you]1247-the poor iron - merchant swear to go hence if [you]1247-the poor iron - merchant are spared ? ”[561-the iron - merchant] “ No , [I]561-the iron - merchant will not , ”[561-the iron - merchant] replied [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant . [He]561-the iron - merchant had scarcely spoken , when the helmet fell with a jerk , and extinguished [him]80-the tinker like the others . [Ginger]92-ginger alone remained . During the whole of this strange scene , [he]92-ginger had stood with the bottle in hand , transfixed with terror and astonishment , and wholly unable to move or cry out . A climax was put to [his]92-ginger fright , by the descent of the three chairs , with [[their]1250-their occupants]1251-their occupants , through the floor into a vault beneath ; and as the helmets were whisked up again to the ceiling , and the trap - doors closed upon the chairs , [he]92-ginger dropped the bottle , and fell with [his]92-ginger face upon the table . [He]92-ginger was , however , soon roused by a pull at [his]92-ginger hair , while a shrill voice called [him]92-ginger by [his]92-ginger name . “ Who is it ? ”[507-the dog - fancier] groaned [the dog - fancier]507-the dog - fancier . “ Look up ! ”[1253-the speaker] cried [the speaker]1253-the speaker , again plucking [his]92-ginger hair . [Ginger]92-ginger complied , and beheld the monkey seated beside [him]92-ginger . “ Vy , it ca n’t be , surely , ”[92-ginger] [he]92-ginger cried . “ And yet [I]92-ginger could almost svear it was [Old Parr]90-old parr . ”[92-ginger] “ [You]92-ginger ’re near the mark , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other , with a shrill laugh . “ It is [[your]92-ginger venerable friend]2168-your venerable friend . ”[244-the other] “ Vot the deuce are [you]479-the dwarf doing here , and in this dress , or rayther undress ? ”[92-ginger] inquired [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Ven [I]92-ginger see [you]479-the dwarf this mornin ’ , [you]479-the dwarf wos in the serwice of [Mr. Loftus]143-loftus . ”[92-ginger] “ [I]479-the dwarf ’ve got [a new master]2169-a new master since then , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [I]92-ginger ’m sorry to hear it , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , shaking [his]92-ginger head . “ [You]92-ginger have n’t sold [yourself]92-ginger , like [Doctor Forster]186-doctor forster — eh ? ”[92-ginger] “ [Faustus]187-faustus , [[my]90-old parr dear]2170-my dear [Ginger]92-ginger — not [Forster]186-doctor forster , ”[90-old parr] corrected [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ No , no , [I]90-old parr ’ve made no bargain . And to be plain with [you]92-ginger , [I]90-old parr ’ve no desire to remain long in [[my]90-old parr present master]2171-my present master ’s service . ”[90-old parr] “ [I]92-ginger do n’t like to ask the question too directly , wenerable , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger , in a deprecatory tone—“but is [[your]92-ginger master]2172-your master — hem!—is [he]2172-your master — hem!—the — the — — ”[90-old parr] “ [The devil]1650-the devil , [you]92-ginger would say , ”[90-old parr] supplied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ Between [ourselves]2174-ourselves , [I]90-old parr ’m afraid there ’s no denying it . ”[90-old parr] “ La ! wot a horrible idea ! ”[92-ginger] exclaimed [Ginger]92-ginger , with a shudder ; “ it makes the flesh creep on one ’s bones . Then [we]2174-ourselves ’re in [[your]92-ginger master]2172-your master ’s power ? ”[92-ginger] “ Very like it , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ And there ai n’t no chance o ’ deliverance ? ”[90-old parr] “ None that occurs to [me]90-old parr . ”[90-old parr] “ [O Lord]2176-o lord ! [O Lord]2177-o lord ! ”[92-ginger] groaned [Ginger]92-ginger ; “ [I]92-ginger ’ll repent . [I]92-ginger ’ll become [a reformed character]2178-a reformed character . [I]92-ginger ’ll never steal dogs no more . ”[92-ginger] “ In that case , there may be some chance for [you]92-ginger , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ [I]90-old parr think [I]90-old parr could help [you]92-ginger to escape . Come with [me]90-old parr , and [I]90-old parr ’ll try and get [you]92-ginger out . ”[90-old parr] “ But wot is to become of the others ? ”[92-ginger] demanded [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Oh , leave [them]2179-them to [their]2179-them fate , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ No , that ’ll never do , ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Ve’re all in [the same boat]2180-the same boat , and must row out together the best vay ve can . [I]90-old parr tell [you]92-ginger wot it is , wenerable , ”[90-old parr] [he]90-old parr added , seizing [him]92-ginger by the [throat—“your master]2181-throat—“your master may be [the devil]1650-the devil , but [you]92-ginger ’re mortal ; and if [you]92-ginger do n’t help [me]90-old parr to deliver [[my]90-old parr companions]2183-my companions , [I]90-old parr ’ll squeege [your]92-ginger windpipe for [you]92-ginger . ”[90-old parr] “ That ’s not the way to induce [me]90-old parr to help [you]92-ginger , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr , twisting [himself]90-old parr like an eel out of the other ’s gripe . “ Now get out , if [you]92-ginger can . ”[90-old parr] “ Do n’t be angry , ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , seeing the mistake [he]90-old parr had committed , and trying to conciliate [him]90-old parr ; “ [I]92-ginger only meant to frighten [you]90-old parr a bit . Can [you]90-old parr tell [me]92-ginger if [Mr. Auriol Darcy]93-auriol is here ? ”[92-ginger] “ Yes , [he]93-auriol is , and [a close prisoner]2184-a close prisoner , ”[90-old parr] replied [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ And [the girl]600-the girl — [Miss Ebber]188-miss ebber , wot of [her]600-the girl ? ”[90-old parr] “ [I]90-old parr ca n’t say , ”[90-old parr] rejoined [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ [I]90-old parr can only speak to [the living]2186-the living . ”[90-old parr] “ Then [she]600-the girl ’s dead ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , with a look of horror . “ That ’s a secret , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf mysteriously ; “ and [I]479-the dwarf ’m bound by a terrible oath not to disclose it . ”[479-the dwarf] “ [I]92-ginger ’ll have it out of [you]479-the dwarf notvithstandin ’ , ”[92-ginger] muttered [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [I]92-ginger vish [you]479-the dwarf would lend [me]92-ginger a knock on the head , [old feller]2187-old feller . [I]92-ginger ca n’t help thinkin ’ [I]92-ginger ’ve got a terrible fit o ’ the nightmare . ”[92-ginger] “ Let this waken [you]92-ginger , then , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr , giving [him]92-ginger a sound buffet on the ear . “ [Holloa]189-holloa , [wenerable]2188-wenerable ! not so hard ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger . “ Ha ! ha ! ha ! ”[479-the dwarf] screamed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [You]92-ginger know what [you]92-ginger ’re about now . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Not exactly , ”[92-ginger] said [Ginger]92-ginger . “ [I]92-ginger vish [I]92-ginger wos fairly out o ’ [this cursed place]2189-this cursed place ! ”[92-ginger] “ [You]92-ginger should n’t have ventured into [the lion ’s den]2190-the lion ’s den , ”[90-old parr] said [Old Parr]90-old parr , in a taunting tone . “ But come with [me]90-old parr , and perhaps [I]90-old parr may be able to do something towards [your]92-ginger liberation . ”[90-old parr] So saying , [he]90-old parr drew aside the tapestry , and opened a panel behind it , through which [he]90-old parr passed , and beckoned [Ginger]92-ginger to follow [him]90-old parr . Taking a pistol from [his]90-old parr pocket , [the latter]922-the latter complied . Before the chair , in which [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft was fixed , reached the ground , terror had taken away [his]86-mr. thorneycroft senses . A bottle of salts , placed to [his]86-mr. thorneycroft nose , revived [him]86-mr. thorneycroft after a time ; but [he]86-mr. thorneycroft had nearly relapsed into insensibility on seeing [two strange figures]1259-two strange figures , in hideous masks and sable cloaks , standing on either side of [him]86-mr. thorneycroft , while at a little distance was a third , who carried a strangely - fashioned lantern . [He]86-mr. thorneycroft looked round for [[his]86-mr. thorneycroft companions]420-his companions in misfortune , but , though the chairs were there , [they]1261-they were unoccupied . [The masked attendants]1262-the masked attendants paid no attention to [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant ’s cries and entreaties ; but as soon as [they]1262-the masked attendants thought [him]86-mr. thorneycroft able to move , [they]1262-the masked attendants touched a spring , which freed [his]86-mr. thorneycroft arms and legs from [their]1262-the masked attendants bondage , and raising [him]86-mr. thorneycroft , dragged [him]86-mr. thorneycroft out of [the vault]322-the vault , and along [a narrow passage]1265-a narrow passage , till [they]1262-the masked attendants came to [a large sepulchral - looking chamber , cased with black marble]1266-a large sepulchral - looking chamber , cased with black marble , in the midst of which , on a velvet fauteuil of the same hue as the walls , sat [Cyprian Rougemont]167-rougemont . It was , in fact , [the chamber where [Ebba]114-ebba had been subject to [her]114-ebba terrible trial]1267-the chamber where ebba had been subject to her terrible trial . Bewildered with terror , [the poor iron - merchant]1247-the poor iron - merchant threw [himself]1247-the poor iron - merchant at the feet of [Rougemont]167-rougemont , who , eyeing [him]1247-the poor iron - merchant with a look of malignant triumph , cried — “ [You]1247-the poor iron - merchant have come to seek [[your]1247-the poor iron - merchant daughter]1973-your daughter . Behold [her]114-ebba ! ”[167-rougemont] And at the words , the large black curtains at the farther end of [the room]405-the room were suddenly withdrawn , and discovered the figure of [Ebba Thorneycroft]114-ebba standing at the foot of the marble staircase . [Her]114-ebba features were as pale as death ; [her]114-ebba limbs rigid and motionless ; but [her]114-ebba eyes blazed with preternatural light . On beholding [her]114-ebba , [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft uttered a loud cry , and , springing to [his]86-mr. thorneycroft feet , would have rushed towards [her]114-ebba , but [he]86-mr. thorneycroft was held back by [the two masked attendants]1270-the two masked attendants , who seized each arm , and detained [him]86-mr. thorneycroft by main force . “ [Ebba]114-ebba ! ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] [he]86-mr. thorneycroft cried—“Ebba ! ”[114-ebba] But [she]114-ebba appeared wholly insensible to [his]86-mr. thorneycroft cries , and remained in the same attitude , with [her]114-ebba eyes turned away from [him]86-mr. thorneycroft . “ What ails [her]114-ebba ? ”[1271-the agonised father] cried [the agonised father]1271-the agonised father . “ [Ebba]114-ebba ! [Ebba]114-ebba ! ”[1271-the agonised father] “ Call louder , ”[167-rougemont] said [Rougemont]167-rougemont , with a jeering laugh . “ Do [you]86-mr. thorneycroft not know [me]86-mr. thorneycroft ? do [you]86-mr. thorneycroft not hear [me]86-mr. thorneycroft ? ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] shrieked [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft . [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft groaned aloud . “ Are [you]86-mr. thorneycroft not content ? ”[167-rougemont] cried [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ Will [you]86-mr. thorneycroft depart in peace , and swear never to come here more ? [He]164-reeks held a pistol in either hand . “ Is it [you]192-gerard paston , [Gerard Paston]192-gerard paston ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , regarding [him]164-reeks ; “ [the brother of [Clara]193-clara]2199-the brother of clara , [[my]93-auriol second victim]2200-my second victim ! ”[93-auriol] “ It is , ”[244-the other] replied [the other]244-the other . “ [Your]93-auriol deliverance is at hand , [Auriol]93-auriol . ”[244-the other] “ And [you]192-gerard paston have dared to penetrate here , [Gerard]192-gerard paston ? ”[167-rougemont] cried [Rougemont]167-rougemont , stamping the ground with rage . “ Recollect , [you]93-auriol are bound to [me]167-rougemont by the same ties as [Auriol]93-auriol , and [you]93-auriol shall share [his]93-auriol fate . ”[167-rougemont] “ [I]192-gerard paston am not to be intimidated by threats , ”[192-gerard paston] replied [Paston]192-gerard paston , with a scornful laugh . “ [You]93-auriol have employed [your]93-auriol arts too long . Deliver up [Auriol]93-auriol and [this gentleman]1953-this gentleman at once , or — — ”[192-gerard paston] And [he]192-gerard paston levelled the pistols at [him]192-gerard paston . “ Fire ! ”[167-rougemont] cried [Rougemont]167-rougemont , drawing [himself]167-rougemont up to [his]167-rougemont towering height . “ No earthly bullets can injure [me]167-rougemont . ”[167-rougemont] “ [Ve’ll]85-ve’ll try that ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , coming up at the moment behind [Paston]192-gerard paston . And [he]92-ginger discharged a pistol , with a deliberate aim , at the breast of [Rougemont]167-rougemont . [The latter]922-the latter remained erect , and apparently uninjured . “ [You]167-rougemont see how ineffectual [your]167-rougemont weapons are , ”[167-rougemont] said [Rougemont]167-rougemont , with a derisive laugh . “ It must be the devil ! ”[92-ginger] cried [Ginger]92-ginger , running off . “ [I]192-gerard paston will try [mine]192-gerard paston , ”[192-gerard paston] said [Paston]192-gerard paston . But before [he]192-gerard paston could draw the triggers , the pistols were wrested from [his]192-gerard paston grasp by [the two attendants]1284-the two attendants , who had quitted [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , and stolen upon [him]192-gerard paston unperceived , and who next pinioned [his]192-gerard paston arms . So bewildered was [the poor iron - merchant]1247-the poor iron - merchant by the strange and terrible events that had befallen [him]192-gerard paston , that , though released by [the two masked attendants]1270-the two masked attendants , who left [him]192-gerard paston , as before related , to seize [Gerard Paston]192-gerard paston , [he]192-gerard paston felt utterly incapable of exertion , and would probably have made no effort to regain [his]192-gerard paston freedom , if [his]192-gerard paston coat had not been vigorously plucked behind , while a low voice urged [him]192-gerard paston to fly . Glancing in the direction of [the friendly speaker]1287-the friendly speaker , [he]192-gerard paston could just discern a diminutive object standing within the entrance of [a side - passage]1288-a side - passage , and reared up against the wall so as to be out of sight of [Rougemont]167-rougemont and [[his]167-rougemont attendants]1209-his attendants . It was the monkey — or rather [Old Parr]90-old parr — who , continuing to tug violently at [his]192-gerard paston coat , at last succeeded in drawing [him]192-gerard paston backwards into [the passage]284-the passage , and then grasping [his]192-gerard paston hand tightly , hurried [him]192-gerard paston along it . [The passage]284-the passage was wholly unlighted , but [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft could perceive that [it]284-the passage was exceedingly circuitous , and winded round like a maze . “ Where are [you]479-the dwarf taking [me]192-gerard paston ? ”[192-gerard paston] [he]192-gerard paston inquired , attempting to stop . “ Ask no questions , ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , pulling [him]192-gerard paston along . “ Do [you]192-gerard paston want to be captured , and shut up in [a cell]1217-a cell for the rest of [your]192-gerard paston life ? ”[479-the dwarf] “ Certainly not , ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] replied [Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft , accelerating [his]86-mr. thorneycroft movements ; “ [I]86-mr. thorneycroft hope there ’s no chance of it . ”[86-mr. thorneycroft] “ There ’s every chance of it , ”[90-old parr] rejoined [Old Parr]90-old parr . “ If [you]192-gerard paston ’re taken , [you]192-gerard paston ’ll share [Auriol]93-auriol ’s fate . ”[90-old parr] “ [O Lord]2203-o lord ! [I]561-the iron - merchant hope not , ”[561-the iron - merchant] groaned [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant . “ [I]561-the iron - merchant declare , [you]192-gerard paston frighten [me]561-the iron - merchant so much that [you]192-gerard paston take away all power of movement . [I]561-the iron - merchant shall drop in a minute . ”[561-the iron - merchant] “ Come along , [I]479-the dwarf say , ”[479-the dwarf] screamed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [I]479-the dwarf hear [them]2204-them close behind [us]2205-us . ”[479-the dwarf] And as [he]561-the iron - merchant spoke , shouts , and the noise of rapidly - approaching footsteps , resounded along [the passage]284-the passage . “ [I]561-the iron - merchant ca n’t stir another step , ”[561-the iron - merchant] gasped [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant . “ [I]561-the iron - merchant ’m completely done . Better yield at once . ”[561-the iron - merchant] “ What , without a struggle ? ”[479-the dwarf] cried [the dwarf]479-the dwarf tauntingly . “ Think of [[your]561-the iron - merchant daughter]1973-your daughter , and let the thought of [her]1973-your daughter nerve [your]561-the iron - merchant heart . [She]1973-your daughter is lost for ever , if [you]561-the iron - merchant do n’t get out of [this accursed place]2207-this accursed place . ”[479-the dwarf] “ [She]1973-your daughter is lost for ever as it is , ”[561-the iron - merchant] cried [the iron - merchant]561-the iron - merchant despairingly . “ No — [she]1973-your daughter may yet be saved , ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Come on — come on — [they]1301-their pursuers are close behind [us]1300-us . ”[479-the dwarf] And it was evident , from the increased clamour , that [[their]1300-us pursuers]1301-their pursuers were upon [them]1300-us . Roused by the imminence of the danger , and by the hope of rescuing [[his]561-the iron - merchant daughter]839-his daughter , [Mr. Thorneycroft]86-mr. thorneycroft exerted all [his]561-the iron - merchant energies , and sprang forward . A little farther on , [they]1300-us were stopped by a door . It was closed ; and venting [his]561-the iron - merchant disappointment in a scream , [the dwarf]479-the dwarf searched for the handle , but could not find it . “ [We]1300-us are entrapped — [we]1300-us shall be caught , ”[561-the iron - merchant] [he]561-the iron - merchant cried , “ and then woe to [both of [us]1300-us]2208-both of us . Somewhat revived , [he]479-the dwarf went on , but with great deliberation , and it was well [he]479-the dwarf did so , for [he]479-the dwarf suddenly arrived at the brink of a pit about eight feet in depth , into which , if [he]479-the dwarf had approached [it]1334-it incautiously , [he]479-the dwarf must infallibly have stumbled , and in all probability have broken [his]479-the dwarf neck . [This pit]1335-this pit evidently communicated with a lower range of chambers , as was shown by a brazen lamp burning under an archway . At the same time [the Sandman]247-the sandman rushed towards the ladder , but before [he]247-the sandman could mount it all egress by that means was cut off . An immense iron cover worked in a groove was pushed by some unseen machinery over the top of [the pit]1349-the pit , and enclosed [them]1350-them in it . For several hours deep sleep , occasioned by some potent medicaments , had bound up the senses of [Auriol]93-auriol . On awaking , [he]247-the sandman found [himself]247-the sandman within [a cell]1217-a cell , the walls , the floor , and the ceiling of which were of solid stone masonry . In the midst of [this chamber]1025-this chamber , and supporting the ponderous roof , stood a massive granite pillar , the capital of which was grotesquely ornamented with death’s - heads and cross - bones , and against this pillar leaned [Auriol]93-auriol , with [his]93-auriol left arm chained by heavy links of iron to a ring in the adjoining wall . Beside [him]93-auriol stood a pitcher of water , and near [him]93-auriol lay an antique - looking book , bound in black vellum . [The dungeon in which [he]93-auriol was confined]1353-the dungeon in which he was confined was circular in form , with a coved roof , sustained by the pillar before mentioned , and was approached by a steep flight of steps rising from a doorway , placed some six feet below the level of [the chamber]1641-the chamber , and surmounted by a pointed arch . A stream of light , descending from a narrow aperture in the roof , fell upon [his]93-auriol wasted and haggard features . [His]93-auriol dark - brown hair hung about [his]93-auriol face in elf - locks , [his]93-auriol beard was untrimmed , and a fixed and stony glare like that of insanity sat in [his]93-auriol eye . [He]93-auriol was seated on the ground — neither bench nor stool being allowed [him]93-auriol — with [his]93-auriol hand supporting [his]93-auriol chin . [His]93-auriol gaze was fixed upon vacancy — if that can [he]93-auriol called vacancy which to [him]93-auriol was filled with vivid images . [His]93-auriol garb was not that of modern times , but consisted of a doublet and hose of rich material , wrought in the fashion of [Elizabeth]195-elizabeth ’s days . After remaining for some time in this musing attitude , [Auriol]93-auriol opened the old tome before [him]93-auriol , and began to turn over its leaves . It was full of magical disquisitions and mysterious characters , and [he]93-auriol found inscribed on one of its earlier pages a name which instantly riveted [his]93-auriol attention . Having vainly sought some explanation of this name in the after contents of the book , [he]93-auriol laid it aside , and became lost in meditation . [His]93-auriol reverie ended , [he]93-auriol heaved a deep sigh , and turned again to the open volume lying before [him]93-auriol , and in doing so [his]93-auriol eye rested for the first time on [his]93-auriol habiliments . On beholding [them]1355-them [he]93-auriol started , and held out [his]93-auriol arm to examine [his]93-auriol sleeve more narrowly . Satisfied that [he]93-auriol was not deceived , [he]93-auriol arose and examined [himself]93-auriol from head to foot . [He]93-auriol found [himself]93-auriol , as has been stated , attired in the garb of [a gentleman of [Elizabeth]195-elizabeth ’s time]1356-a gentleman of elizabeth ’s time . “ What can this mean ? ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol cried . “ Have [I]93-auriol endured a long and troubled dream , during which [I]93-auriol have fancied [myself]93-auriol living through more than two centuries ? O Heaven , that it may be so ! Oh that the fearful crimes [I]93-auriol suppose [I]93-auriol have committed have only been enacted in a dream ! Oh that [[my]93-auriol victims]2086-my victims are imaginary ! Oh that [Ebba]114-ebba should only prove a lovely phantom of the night ! And yet , [I]93-auriol could almost wish the rest were real — so that [she]114-ebba might exist . [I]93-auriol can not bear to think that [she]114-ebba is nothing more than a vision . But it must be so — [I]93-auriol have been dreaming — and what a dream it has been!—what strange glimpses it has afforded [me]93-auriol into futurity ! Methought [I]93-auriol lived in the reigns of [many sovereigns]2237-many sovereigns — beheld one of [them]2237-many sovereigns carried to the block — saw revolutions convulse [the kingdom]2238-the kingdom — old dynasties shaken down , and new ones spring up . Fashions seem to [me]93-auriol to have so changed , that [I]93-auriol had clean forgotten the old ones ; while [[my]93-auriol fellow - men]2239-my fellow - men scarcely appeared the same as heretofore . Can [I]93-auriol be the same [myself]93-auriol ? Is this the dress [I]93-auriol once wore ? Let [me]93-auriol seek for some proof . ”[93-auriol] And thrusting [his]1357-his hand into [his]1357-his doublet , [he]1357-his drew forth some tablets , and hastily examined them . They bore [his]1357-his name , and contained some writing , and [he]1357-his exclaimed aloud with joy , “ This is proof enough — [I]1357-his have been dreaming all this while . ”[1357-his] “ The scheme works to a miracle , ”[1358-a personage stationed at the foot of the steps springing from the doorway] muttered [a personage stationed at the foot of the steps springing from the doorway]1358-a personage stationed at the foot of the steps springing from the doorway , and who , though concealed from view [himself]1358-a personage stationed at the foot of the steps springing from the doorway , was watching [the prisoner]1218-the prisoner with a malignant and exulting gaze . “ And yet , why am [I]93-auriol here ? ”[93-auriol] pursued [Auriol]93-auriol , looking around . “ Ah ! [I]93-auriol see how it is , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol added , with a shudder ; “ [I]93-auriol have been mad — perhaps am mad still . That will account for the strange delusion under which [I]93-auriol have laboured . ”[93-auriol] “ [I]1360-the listener will act upon that hint , ”[1360-the listener] muttered [the listener]1360-the listener . “ Of what use is memory , ”[93-auriol] continued [Auriol]93-auriol musingly , “ if things that are not , seem as if they were ? If joys and sorrows which [we]2240-we have never endured are stamped upon the brain — if visions of scenes , and faces and events which [we]2240-we have never witnessed , never known , haunt [us]2240-we , as if they had once been familiar ? But [I]93-auriol am mad — mad ! ”[93-auriol] [The listener]1360-the listener laughed to [himself]1360-the listener . “ How else , if [I]1360-the listener were not mad , could [I]1360-the listener have believed that [I]1360-the listener had swallowed the fabled elixir vitæ ? And yet , is it a fable ? for [I]1360-the listener am puzzled still . Methinks [I]1360-the listener am old — old — old — though [I]1360-the listener feel young , and look young . All this is madness . Yet how clear and distinct it seems ! [I]1360-the listener can call to mind events in [Charles the Second]196-charles the second ’s time . [Ha!—who]191-ha!—who told [me]1360-the listener of [Charles the Second]196-charles the second ? How know [I]1360-the listener there was such [a king]1596-a king ? [The reigning sovereign]2242-the reigning sovereign should be [James]107-james the first , and yet [I]1360-the listener fancy it is [George the Fourth]197-george the fourth . Oh ! [I]1360-the listener am mad — clean mad ! ”[1360-the listener] There was another pause , during which [the listener]1360-the listener indulged in a suppressed fit of laughter . “ Would [I]93-auriol could look forth from [this dungeon]2243-this dungeon , ”[93-auriol] pursued [Auriol]93-auriol , again breaking silence , “ and satisfy [myself]93-auriol of the truth or falsehood of [my]93-auriol doubts by a view of [the external world]2244-the external world , for [I]93-auriol am so perplexed in mind , that if [I]93-auriol were not distracted already , [they]2245-they would be enough to drive [me]93-auriol so . ”[93-auriol] demanded [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Ah ! is it [you]167-rougemont , [Fiend]199-fiend ? ”[93-auriol] “ What , [you]167-rougemont are still in [your]167-rougemont old fancies , ”[167-rougemont] rejoined [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ [I]167-rougemont thought the draught [I]167-rougemont gave [you]93-auriol last night would have amended [you]93-auriol . ”[167-rougemont] “ Tell [me]93-auriol who and what [I]93-auriol am , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , stupefied with astonishment ; “ in what age [I]93-auriol am living ; and whether [I]93-auriol am in [my]93-auriol right mind or not ? ”[93-auriol] “ For the first , [you]167-rougemont are called [Auriol Darcy]93-auriol , ”[167-rougemont] replied [Rougemont]167-rougemont ; “ for the second , [you]167-rougemont are living in the reign of [[his]2249-his most Catholic Majesty James I. of [England]77-england , and Sixth of [Scotland]78-scotland]200-his most catholic majesty james i. of england , and sixth of scotland ; and for the third , [I]167-rougemont trust [you]167-rougemont will soon recover [your]167-rougemont reason . ”[167-rougemont] “ Amazement ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , striking [his]93-auriol brow with [his]93-auriol clenched hand . “ Then [I]93-auriol am mad . ”[93-auriol] “ It ’s plain [your]167-rougemont reason is returning , since [you]167-rougemont are conscious of [your]167-rougemont condition , ”[167-rougemont] replied [Rougemont]167-rougemont ; “ but calm [yourself]167-rougemont , [you]167-rougemont have been subject to raging frenzies . ”[167-rougemont] “ And [I]93-auriol have been shut up here for safety ? ”[93-auriol] demanded [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Precisely , ”[244-the other] observed [the other]244-the other . “ And [you]167-rougemont are — — ”[244-the other] “ [[Your]167-rougemont keeper]2250-your keeper , ”[167-rougemont] replied [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ [[My]93-auriol God]2251-my god ! what a brain [mine]93-auriol must be ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Answer [me]93-auriol one question — Is there [such a person as [Ebba Thorneycroft]114-ebba]2252-such a person as ebba thorneycroft ? ”[93-auriol] “ [You]167-rougemont have often raved about [her]114-ebba , ”[167-rougemont] replied [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ But [she]114-ebba is [a mere creature of the imagination]2253-a mere creature of the imagination . ”[167-rougemont] [Auriol]93-auriol groaned , and sank against the wall . “ Since [you]93-auriol have become so reasonable , [you]93-auriol shall again go forth into [the world]1457-the world , ”[167-rougemont] said [Rougemont]167-rougemont ; “ but the first essay must be made at night , for fear of attracting observation . [I]167-rougemont will come to [you]93-auriol again a few hours hence . Farewell for the present . ”[167-rougemont] And casting a sinister glance at [[his]167-rougemont captive]1367-his captive , [he]167-rougemont turned upon [his]167-rougemont heel , descended the steps , and quitted [the cell]1274-the cell . Night came , and [the cell]1274-the cell grew profoundly dark . [Auriol]93-auriol became impatient for the appearance of [[his]93-auriol keeper]1370-his keeper , but hour after hour passed and [he]1370-his keeper did not arrive . Worn out , at length , with doubt and bewildering speculations , [the miserable captive]1371-the miserable captive was beset with the desire to put an end to [his]1371-the miserable captive torments by suicide , and [he]1371-the miserable captive determined to execute [his]1371-the miserable captive fell purpose without delay . An evil chance seemed also to befriend [him]1371-the miserable captive , for scarcely was the idea formed , than [his]1371-the miserable captive foot encountered something on the ground , the rattling of which attracted [his]1371-the miserable captive attention , and stooping to take it up , [he]1371-the miserable captive grasped the bare blade of a knife . “ This will , at all events , solve [my]1371-the miserable captive doubts , ”[1371-the miserable captive] [he]1371-the miserable captive cried aloud . “ [I]1371-the miserable captive will sheathe this weapon in [my]1371-the miserable captive heart , and , if [I]1371-the miserable captive am mortal , [my]1371-the miserable captive woes will be ended . ”[1371-the miserable captive] As [he]1371-the miserable captive spoke , [he]1371-the miserable captive placed the point to [his]1371-the miserable captive breast with the full intent to strike , but before [he]1371-the miserable captive could inflict the slightest wound , [his]1371-the miserable captive arm was forcibly arrested . “ Would [you]1371-the miserable captive destroy [yourself]1371-the miserable captive , [madman]2255-madman ? ”[1371-the miserable captive] roared a voice . “ [I]1371-the miserable captive thought [your]1371-the miserable captive violence was abated , and that [you]1371-the miserable captive might go forth in safety . But [I]1371-the miserable captive find [you]1371-the miserable captive are worse than ever . ”[1371-the miserable captive] [Auriol]93-auriol uttered a groan and let the knife fall to the ground . [The new - comer]326-the new - comer kicked it to a distance with [his]93-auriol foot . “ [You]1371-the miserable captive shall be removed to [another chamber]2256-another chamber , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol pursued , “ where [you]1371-the miserable captive can be more strictly watched . ”[93-auriol] “ Take [me]93-auriol forth — oh ! take [me]93-auriol forth , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ It was a mere impulse of desperation , which [I]93-auriol now repent . ”[93-auriol] “ [I]93-auriol dare not trust [you]1371-the miserable captive . [You]1371-the miserable captive will commit some act of insane fury , for which [I]93-auriol [myself]93-auriol shall have to bear the blame . When [I]93-auriol yielded to [your]1371-the miserable captive entreaties on a former occasion , and took [you]1371-the miserable captive forth , [I]93-auriol narrowly prevented [you]1371-the miserable captive from doing all [we]2257-we met a mischief . ”[93-auriol] “ [I]93-auriol have no recollection of any such circumstance , ”[93-auriol] returned [Auriol]93-auriol mournfully . “ But it may be true , nevertheless . And if so , it only proves the lamentable condition to which [I]93-auriol am reduced — memory and reason gone ! ”[93-auriol] “ Ay , both gone , ”[244-the other] cried [the other]244-the other , with an irrepressible chuckle . “ Ha ! ”[93-auriol] exclaimed [Auriol]93-auriol , starting . “ [I]93-auriol am not so mad but [I]93-auriol recognise in [you]1371-the miserable captive the Evil Being who tempted [me]93-auriol . [I]93-auriol am not so oblivious as to forget [our]2257-we terrible interviews . ”[93-auriol] “ What , [you]1371-the miserable captive are in [your]1371-the miserable captive lunes again ! ”[167-rougemont] cried [Rougemont]167-rougemont fiercely . “ Nay , then [I]167-rougemont must call [[my]167-rougemont assistants]2258-my assistants , and bind [you]1371-the miserable captive . ”[167-rougemont] “ Let [me]93-auriol be — let [me]93-auriol be ! ”[93-auriol] implored [Auriol]93-auriol , “ and [I]93-auriol will offend [you]93-auriol no more . Whatever thoughts may arise within [me]93-auriol , [I]93-auriol will not give utterance to [them]2259-them . Only take [me]93-auriol forth . ”[93-auriol] “ [I]167-rougemont came for that purpose , ”[167-rougemont] said [Rougemont]167-rougemont ; “ but [I]167-rougemont repeat , [I]167-rougemont dare not . [You]93-auriol are not sufficiently master of [yourself]93-auriol . ”[167-rougemont] “ Try [me]93-auriol , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Well , ”[244-the other] rejoined [the other]244-the other , “ [I]244-the other will see what [I]244-the other can do to calm [you]1375-the captive . ”[244-the other] So saying , [he]244-the other disappeared for a few moments , and then returning with a torch , placed it on the ground , and producing a phial , handed it to [the captive]1375-the captive . “ Drink ! ”[244-the other] [he]244-the other said . Without a moment ’s hesitation [Auriol]93-auriol complied . “ It seems to [me]93-auriol rather a stimulant than a soothing potion , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol remarked , after emptying the phial . “ [You]1375-the captive are in no condition to judge , ”[244-the other] rejoined [the other]244-the other . And [he]244-the other proceeded to unfasten [Auriol]93-auriol ’s chain . “ Now then , come with [me]244-the other , ”[244-the other] [he]244-the other said , “ and do not make any attempt at evasion , or [you]93-auriol will rue it . ”[244-the other] Like [one in a dream]1377-one in a dream , [Auriol]93-auriol followed [his]93-auriol conductor down the flight of stone steps leading from [the dungeon]1378-the dungeon , and along [a narrow passage]1265-a narrow passage . As [he]93-auriol proceeded , [he]93-auriol thought [he]93-auriol heard stealthy footsteps behind [him]93-auriol ; but [he]93-auriol never turned [his]93-auriol head , to see whether [he]93-auriol was really followed . In this way [they]1380-they reached [a short steep staircase]1381-a short steep staircase , and mounting [it]1381-a short steep staircase , entered [a vault]1032-a vault , in which [Rougemont]167-rougemont paused , and placed the torch [he]167-rougemont had brought with [him]167-rougemont upon the floor . Its lurid glimmer partially illumined [the chamber]1641-the chamber , and showed that [it]1641-the chamber was built of stone . Rude benches of antique form were set about [the vault]322-the vault , and motioning [Auriol]93-auriol to be seated upon one of them , [Rougemont]167-rougemont sounded a silver whistle . The summons was shortly afterwards answered by [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , in whose attire a new change had taken place . [He]479-the dwarf was now clothed in a jerkin of grey serge , fashioned like the garments worn by [the common people in [Elizabeth]195-elizabeth ’s reign]1386-the common people in elizabeth ’s reign , and wore a trencher - cap on [his]479-the dwarf head . [Auriol]93-auriol watched [him]479-the dwarf as [he]479-the dwarf timidly advanced towards [Rougemont]167-rougemont , and had an indistinct recollection of having seen [him]479-the dwarf before ; but could not call to mind how or where . “ Is [[your]167-rougemont master]2172-your master a - bed ? ”[167-rougemont] demanded [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ A - bed ! Good lack , [sir]1707-sir ! ”[479-the dwarf] exclaimed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ little of sleep knows [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb . [He]112-doctor lamb will toil at the furnace till the stars have set . ”[479-the dwarf] “ [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb ! ”[93-auriol] repeated [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Surely [I]93-auriol have heard that name before ? ”[93-auriol] “ Very likely , ”[167-rougemont] replied [Rougemont]167-rougemont , “ for it is the name borne by [[your]167-rougemont nearest kinsman]2262-your nearest kinsman . ”[167-rougemont] “ How is [the poor young gentleman]1453-the poor young gentleman ? ”[479-the dwarf] asked [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , glancing commiseratingly at [Auriol]93-auriol . “ [[My]93-auriol master]1627-my master often makes inquiries after [[his]1627-my master grandson]2265-his grandson , and grieves that the state of [his]1627-my master mind should render it necessary to confine [him]2265-his grandson . ”[93-auriol] “ [[His]1627-my master grandson]2265-his grandson ! [I]93-auriol — [[Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb ’s grandson]2267-doctor lamb ’s grandson ! ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ In sooth are [you]167-rougemont , [young sir]2268-young sir , ”[479-the dwarf] returned [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Were [you]167-rougemont in [your]167-rougemont reason , [you]167-rougemont would be aware that [[my]479-the dwarf master]1627-my master ’s name is the same as [your]167-rougemont own — [Darcy]93-auriol — [Reginald Darcy]201-reginald darcy . [He]1627-my master assumes the name of [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb to delude [the multitude]2270-the multitude . [He]1627-my master told [you]167-rougemont as much [yourself]167-rougemont , [sweet sir]2271-sweet sir , if [your]167-rougemont poor wits would enable [you]167-rougemont to recollect it . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Am [I]93-auriol in a dream , [good fellow]2272-good fellow , tell [me]93-auriol that ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , lost in amazement . “ [Alack]202-alack , no , [sir]1707-sir , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ to [my]93-auriol thinking , [you]167-rougemont are wide awake . But [you]167-rougemont know , [sir]1707-sir , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol added , touching [his]93-auriol forehead , “ [you]167-rougemont have been a little wrong here , and [your]167-rougemont memory and reason are not of the clearest . ”[93-auriol] “ Where does [[my]93-auriol grandsire]2246-my grandsire dwell ? ”[93-auriol] asked [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Why here , [sir]1707-sir , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ and for the matter of locality , [the house]1655-the house is situated on [the south end of [London Bridge]29-london bridge]2278-the south end of london bridge . ”[479-the dwarf] “ On [the bridge]239-the bridge — did [you]479-the dwarf say on [the bridge]239-the bridge , [friend]1743-friend ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Ay , on [the bridge]239-the bridge — where else should it be ? [You]1707-sir would not have [[your]1707-sir grandsire]2283-your grandsire live under [the river]208-the river ? ”[479-the dwarf] rejoined [the dwarf]479-the dwarf ; “ though , for ought [I]479-the dwarf know , some of [these vaults]2285-these vaults may go under it . They are damp enough . ”[479-the dwarf] [Auriol]93-auriol was lost in reflection , and did not observe a sign that passed between [the dwarf]479-the dwarf and [Rougemont]167-rougemont . “ Will it disturb [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb if [[his]112-doctor lamb grandson]2265-his grandson goes up to [him]112-doctor lamb ? ”[922-the latter] said [the latter]922-the latter , after a brief pause . “ [[My]479-the dwarf master]1627-my master does not like to be interrupted in [his]1627-my master operations , as [you]167-rougemont know , [sir]1707-sir , ”[479-the dwarf] replied [the dwarf]479-the dwarf , “ and seldom suffers any one , except [myself]479-the dwarf , to enter [[his]1627-my master laboratory]2289-his laboratory ; but [I]479-the dwarf will make so bold as to introduce [Master Auriol]93-auriol , if [he]1627-my master desires it . ”[479-the dwarf] “ [You]167-rougemont will confer the greatest favour on [me]93-auriol by doing so , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , rising . “ Sit down — sit down ! ”[167-rougemont] said [Rougemont]167-rougemont authoritatively . “ [You]93-auriol can not go up till [the doctor]1630-the doctor has been apprised . Remain here , while [Flapdragon]119-flapdragon and [I]167-rougemont ascertain [his]119-flapdragon wishes . ”[167-rougemont] So saying , [he]167-rougemont quitted [the chamber]1641-the chamber by a farther outlet with [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . During the short time that [Auriol]93-auriol was left alone , [he]93-auriol found it vain to attempt to settle [his]93-auriol thoughts , or to convince [himself]93-auriol that [he]93-auriol was not labouring under some strange delusion . [He]93-auriol was aroused at length by [the dwarf , who returned alone]1398-the dwarf , who returned alone . “ [[Your]93-auriol grandsire]2283-your grandsire will see [you]93-auriol , ”[1399-the mannikin] said [the mannikin]1399-the mannikin . “ One word before [we]2292-we go , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , seizing [his]479-the dwarf arm . “ [Saints]203-saints ! how [you]203-saints frighten [me]479-the dwarf ! ”[479-the dwarf] exclaimed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ [You]93-auriol must keep composed , or [I]479-the dwarf dare not take [you]93-auriol to [[my]479-the dwarf master]1627-my master . ”[479-the dwarf] “ Pardon [me]93-auriol , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol ; “ [I]93-auriol meant not to alarm [you]479-the dwarf . Where is [the person who brought [me]93-auriol hither ? ”[93-auriol] “ What , [[your]203-saints keeper]2250-your keeper]2294-the person who brought me hither ? ” “ what , your keeper ? ”[479-the dwarf] said [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Oh , [he]2250-your keeper is within call . [He]2250-your keeper will come to [you]203-saints anon . Now follow [me]479-the dwarf . ”[479-the dwarf] And taking up the torch , [he]479-the dwarf led the way out of [the chamber]1641-the chamber . Mounting [a spiral staircase]1403-a spiral staircase , apparently within [a turret]1404-a turret , [they]1405-they came to a door , which being opened by [Flapdragon]119-flapdragon , disclosed a scene that well - nigh stupefied [Auriol]93-auriol . It was [the laboratory]1629-the laboratory precisely as [he]93-auriol had seen [it]1629-the laboratory above two centuries ago . The floor was strewn with alchemical implements — the table was covered with mystic parchments inscribed with cabalistic characters — the furnace stood in the corner — crucibles and cucurbites decorated the chimney - board — the sphere and brazen lamp hung from the ceiling — the skeletons grinned from behind the chimney - corner — all was there as [he]93-auriol had seen it before ! There also was [Doctor Lamb]112-doctor lamb , in [his]112-doctor lamb loose gown of sable silk , with a square black cap upon [his]112-doctor lamb venerable head , and [his]112-doctor lamb snowy beard streaming to [his]112-doctor lamb girdle . [The old man]1171-the old man ’s gaze was fixed upon a crucible placed upon the furnace , and [he]1171-the old man was occupied in working the bellows . [He]1171-the old man moved [his]1171-the old man head as [Auriol]93-auriol entered [the chamber]1641-the chamber , and the features became visible . It was a face never to be forgotten . “ Come in , [grandson]2296-grandson , ”[1171-the old man] said [the old man]1171-the old man kindly . “ Come in , and close the door after [you]2296-grandson . The draught affects the furnace — [[my]1171-the old man Athanor]2297-my athanor , as [[we]2298-we adepts]2299-we adepts term it . So [you]2296-grandson are better , [[your]2296-grandson keeper]2250-your keeper tells [me]1171-the old man — much better . ”[1171-the old man] “ Are [you]1171-the old man indeed living ? ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , rushing wildly towards [him]1171-the old man , and attempting to take [his]1171-the old man hand . “ Off — off ! ”[1171-the old man] cried [the old man]1171-the old man , drawing back as if alarmed . “ [You]2296-grandson disturb [my]1171-the old man operations . Keep [him]1171-the old man calm , [Flapdragon]119-flapdragon , or take [him]1171-the old man hence . [He]1171-the old man may do [me]1171-the old man a mischief . ”[1171-the old man] “ [I]93-auriol have no such intention , [sir]1707-sir , ”[93-auriol] said [Auriol]93-auriol ; “ indeed [I]93-auriol have not . [I]93-auriol only wish to be assured that [you]2296-grandson are [[my]93-auriol aged relative]2302-my aged relative . ”[93-auriol] “ To be sure [he]1171-the old man is , [young sir]2268-young sir , ”[479-the dwarf] interposed [the dwarf]479-the dwarf . “ Why should [you]2268-young sir doubt it ? ”[479-the dwarf] “ O [sir]1707-sir , ”[93-auriol] cried [Auriol]93-auriol , throwing [himself]93-auriol at [the old man]1171-the old man ’s feet , “ pity [me]93-auriol if [I]93-auriol am mad ; but offer [me]93-auriol some explanation , which may tend to restore [me]93-auriol to [my]93-auriol senses . [My]93-auriol reason seems gone , yet [I]93-auriol appear capable of receiving impressions from external objects . [I]93-auriol see [you]2296-grandson , and appear to know [you]2296-grandson . [I]93-auriol see [this chamber]1025-this chamber — these alchemical implements — that furnace — these different objects — and [I]93-auriol appear to recognise them . Am [I]93-auriol deceived , or is this real ? ”[93-auriol] “ [You]2296-grandson are not deceived , [[my]1171-the old man son]2306-my son , ”[1171-the old man] replied [the old man]1171-the old man . “ [You]2296-grandson have been in [this room]2307-this room before , and [you]2296-grandson have seen [me]1171-the old man before . It would be useless to explain to [you]2296-grandson now how [you]2296-grandson have suffered from fever , and what visions [your]2296-grandson delirium has produced . When [you]2296-grandson are perfectly restored , [we]2308-we will talk the matter over . ”[1171-the old man] And , as [he]1171-the old man said this , [he]1171-the old man began to blow the fire anew , and watched with great apparent interest the changing colours of the liquid in the cucurbite placed on the furnace . [Auriol]93-auriol looked at [him]1171-the old man earnestly , but could not catch another glance , so intently was [the old man]1171-the old man occupied . At length [he]93-auriol ventured to break the silence . “ [I]93-auriol should feel perfectly convinced , if [I]93-auriol might look forth from that window , ”[93-auriol] [he]93-auriol said . “ Convinced of what ? ”[1171-the old man] rejoined [the old man]1171-the old man somewhat sharply . “ That [I]93-auriol am what [I]93-auriol seem , ”[93-auriol] replied [Auriol]93-auriol . “ Look forth , then , ”[1171-the old man] said [the old man]1171-the old man . “ But do not disturb [me]1171-the old man by idle talk . There is the rosy colour in the projection for which [I]1171-the old man have been so long waiting . ”[1171-the old man] [Auriol]93-auriol then walked to the window and gazed through the tinted panes . It was very dark , and objects could only be imperfectly distinguished . Still [he]93-auriol fancied [he]93-auriol could detect the gleam of [the river]208-the river beneath [him]93-auriol , and what seemed [a long line of houses on [the bridge]239-the bridge]1418-a long line of houses on the bridge . [He]93-auriol also fancied [he]93-auriol discerned [other buildings]1420-other buildings , with the high roofs , [the gables]1421-the gables , and the other architectural peculiarities of [the structures of [Elizabeth]195-elizabeth ’s time]1422-the structures of elizabeth ’s time . [He]93-auriol persuaded [himself]93-auriol , also , that [he]93-auriol could distinguish through the gloom the venerable Gothic pile of [[Saint Paul]204-saint paul ’s Cathedral]79-saint paul ’s cathedral on [the other side of the water]1423-the other side of the water , and , as if to satisfy [him]93-auriol that [he]93-auriol was right , a deep solemn bell tolled forth the hour of two . After a while [he]93-auriol returned from the window , and said to [[his]93-auriol supposed grandsire]1424-his supposed grandsire , “ [I]93-auriol am satisfied . [I]93-auriol have lived centuries in a few nights . ”[93-auriol]
